commit_message:
Separate image building manager

* to do not keep enormous classes separated managers code responsible
  for image building into ImageBuildManager
* added common attributes for every data driver since each manager use it
* separated tests for managers
* test for accepting different managers in CLI

Change-Id: I79a5efae5bff1db11e8757d37f82138269f9e734
Implements: blueprint volume-manager-refactoring

revisions:

Closes-Bug: #1438498
(cherry picked from commit d0127d51bdb9a6b51fec5d91f2dbd72177e4c4ca)

	playbooks/roles/memcached_server/defaults/main.yml
	playbooks/roles/memcached_server/templates/memcached.conf

commit_message:
Configurable memcached connections limit & threads

Increasing memcached_connections may require ulimit to be raised so
that will be done if necessary.

Increasing memcached_threads is not strongly recommended but is
available if needed.

Closes-Bug: #1438498
(cherry picked from commit d0127d51bdb9a6b51fec5d91f2dbd72177e4c4ca)

Conflicts:
	playbooks/roles/memcached_server/defaults/main.yml
	playbooks/roles/memcached_server/templates/memcached.conf
	rpc_deployment/roles/memcached/tasks/main.yml

Change-Id: I6e624f49f2fe5c6865968a01927dfa9861c945ec

subject: Update alarm history only if change in alarm property
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-06-25 16:50:56.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/tests/api/v2/test_alarm_scenarios.py', 'ceilometer/api/controllers/v2/alarms.py'], 'message': "Update alarm history only if change in alarm property

When alarm's property is updated with the same
value, an empty record is added to the alarm
history output.

This fix omits the update to alarm history if
there no changes to any alarm property.

Change-Id: Ib860f371979896c7eedd41a25c3b640bb6dbee31
Closes-Bug: 1465550
"}]
commit_message:
Update alarm history only if change in alarm property

When alarm's property is updated with the same
value, an empty record is added to the alarm
history output.

This fix omits the update to alarm history if
there no changes to any alarm property.

Change-Id: Ib860f371979896c7eedd41a25c3b640bb6dbee31
Closes-Bug: 1465550

commit_message:
Add a new crypt method using cryptography

This updates the default crypt method to use the cryptography module
instead of the oslo crypto utils module. It also refactors decrypt to
remove some duplication.

Change-Id: Ie24aebcb3080725c250a4f3ba726b23a9c995965
Closes-Bug: #1468025

Cellsv2 need to store flavor information for booting an instance. Since this
information will live at the cell API, tables related to flavors need to be

bp flavor-cell-api

Change-Id: I10f5cf8eb8a8556b7cd22cd382f4be5ec0b05aec

commit_message:
Add flavor tables to API database

Cellsv2 need to store flavor information for booting an instance. Since this
information will live at the cell API, tables related to flavors need to be
created in API DB.

bp flavor-cell-api

Change-Id: I10f5cf8eb8a8556b7cd22cd382f4be5ec0b05aec

subject: Make some exceptions Senlin internal errors
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-03 06:57:33.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/common/exception.py'], 'message': 'Make some exceptions Senlin internal errors

Senlin internal errors/exceptions are to be inherited from
InternalError, instead of from SenlinException directly. This will make
the exception space easier to manage.

Change-Id: I2cf15deada838a0c7c397f7344c15d5826e36960
'}]
commit_message:
Make some exceptions Senlin internal errors

Senlin internal errors/exceptions are to be inherited from
InternalError, instead of from SenlinException directly. This will make
the exception space easier to manage.

Change-Id: I2cf15deada838a0c7c397f7344c15d5826e36960

commit_message:
Relocate test modules

This patch moves some engine related patches to a dedicated subdir and
the engine service test cases to yet another level of subdir. It is an
attempt to avoid confusion on finding test cases.

Change-Id: I636fb99dd95f6af9ffedef1eea0ec207512e7f26

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-07-02 15:04:51.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_catalog.py'], 'message': 'Add test case for deleting endpoint with space in url

In the bug report, creating an endpoint with "tenant_i d" in any of
its URLs (internal, public, or admin) allegedly prevented the
endpoint from being deleted.

This test case adds a space to all 3 URLs of an endpoint. It then
deletes this endpoint and attempts to get it. If the get returns
error 404, then it works.

Change-Id: I0cad2410a150fb6967fc5048ebbf00b9b08efcc7
Closes-Bug: #1098564
'}]
commit_message:
Add test case for deleting endpoint with space in url

In the bug report, creating an endpoint with "tenant_i d" in any of
its URLs (internal, public, or admin) allegedly prevented the
endpoint from being deleted.

This test case adds a space to all 3 URLs of an endpoint. It then
deletes this endpoint and attempts to get it. If the get returns
error 404, then it works.

Change-Id: I0cad2410a150fb6967fc5048ebbf00b9b08efcc7
Closes-Bug: #1098564

subject: Clean up bindep invocation in cache-bindep element
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-03 01:54:24.000000000', 'files': ['nodepool/elements/cache-bindep/install.d/50-cache-pkgs'], 'message': 'Clean up bindep invocation in cache-bindep element

Invoke bindep from the bindir for its virtualenv in /usr/bindep-env,
and guard its exit code with true since its normal behavior is to
return zero only when all needed packages are already present.

While here, replace calls to tempfile with mktemp since the former
is not readily available on CentOS 6.x.

Change-Id: I926e73f305b1b54f6855cc4acf3407e91b88213a
'}]
commit_message:
Clean up bindep invocation in cache-bindep element

Invoke bindep from the bindir for its virtualenv in /usr/bindep-env,
and guard its exit code with true since its normal behavior is to
return zero only when all needed packages are already present.

While here, replace calls to tempfile with mktemp since the former
is not readily available on CentOS 6.x.

Change-Id: I926e73f305b1b54f6855cc4acf3407e91b88213a

subject: Call sudo pip /w -H diskimage-builder-install macro
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-01 23:16:11.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/macros.yaml'], 'message': "Call sudo pip /w -H diskimage-builder-install macro

Without passing -H to sudo here, subsequent builders that may use pip
or tox will fail on permission issues in $HOME/.cache.

Also, this adds deboostrap to DIB's supporting packages, as it may be
required depending on what flavor disk is being built.

Change-Id: I19957cbf3b3f97660388617dd07d2010d17409e6
"}]
commit_message:
Call sudo pip /w -H diskimage-builder-install macro

Without passing -H to sudo here, subsequent builders that may use pip
or tox will fail on permission issues in $HOME/.cache.

Also, this adds deboostrap to DIB's supporting packages, as it may be
required depending on what flavor disk is being built.

Change-Id: I19957cbf3b3f97660388617dd07d2010d17409e6

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-07-03 07:04:22.000000000', 'files': ['doc/admin-guide-cloud/networking/section_networking_config-plugins.xml'], 'message': "More fixes for NSX plugin guide

This patch:
- corrects wording replacing 'NSX' with 'NSX-mh' (multi hypervisor) in
  order to clarify to which vmware plugin this document refers to, since
  the package downladed with neutron-plugins-vmware actually contains 3
  distinct plugins
- fix some sentences for style, semantics, or grammar
- adds a clarification concerning retrieval of default transport zone
- removes section on integration of load balancing and firewall on top of
  the NSX-mh plugin, as the Neutron plug-in providing this kind of service
  has been abandoned in favour of the NSX-v plugin, not yet documented in
  openstack-manuals

Change-Id: I4365a87d3f2c6dff312e945f407c1d06a4ca13ed
Closes-Bug: #1466249
"}]
commit_message:
More fixes for NSX plugin guide

This patch:
- corrects wording replacing 'NSX' with 'NSX-mh' (multi hypervisor) in
  order to clarify to which vmware plugin this document refers to, since
  the package downladed with neutron-plugins-vmware actually contains 3
  distinct plugins
- fix some sentences for style, semantics, or grammar
- adds a clarification concerning retrieval of default transport zone
- removes section on integration of load balancing and firewall on top of
  the NSX-mh plugin, as the Neutron plug-in providing this kind of service
  has been abandoned in favour of the NSX-v plugin, not yet documented in
  openstack-manuals

Change-Id: I4365a87d3f2c6dff312e945f407c1d06a4ca13ed
Closes-Bug: #1466249

subject: Don't apply strict parsing rules to stable branches.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-02 22:04:56.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/scripts/project-requirements-change.py'], 'message': "Don't apply strict parsing rules to stable branches.

Reasoning is:
 - devstack etc protect us from functional issues
 - we're backporting to stable, so guarding against
   aesthetics and DRY concerns is not our business anymore
 - if in future we have other not-functional linty style
   things to add, we don't want them to affect stable
   either.

Change-Id: I8e891b8fdb6acfdf5e7e084467ee8596f51c251a
"}]
commit_message:
Don't apply strict parsing rules to stable branches.

Reasoning is:
 - devstack etc protect us from functional issues
 - we're backporting to stable, so guarding against
   aesthetics and DRY concerns is not our business anymore
 - if in future we have other not-functional linty style
   things to add, we don't want them to affect stable
   either.

Change-Id: I8e891b8fdb6acfdf5e7e084467ee8596f51c251a

commit_message:
Fix slow tests in RetriesTestCase

This patch mock the time.sleep function in RetriesTestCase class so we
don't spend time sleeping on the tests.

Closes-Bug: #1470914
Change-Id: Ia1e5e9da929fe1544333e4b609b94ea1506f85f8

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5805, 'name': 'Chris Krelle', 'email': 'nobodycam@gmail.com', 'username': 'nobodycam'}, {'_account_id': 6618, 'name': 'Ruby Loo', 'email': 'opensrloo@gmail.com', 'username': 'rloo'}, {'_account_id': 8125, 'name': 'Michael Davies', 'email': 'michael@the-davies.net', 'username': 'mrda'}, {'_account_id': 9162, 'name': 'Lana Brindley', 'email': 'openstack@lanabrindley.com', 'username': 'loquacity'}, {'_account_id': 9751, 'name': 'IBM DB2 CI', 'email': 'scecd@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'ibmdb2', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 13997, 'name': 'SHIGEMATSU Mitsuhiro', 'email': 'shigematsu.mitsuhiro@lab.ntt.co.jp', 'username': 'pshige'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-05-31 15:02:05.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/index.rst', 'doc/source/dev/install-guide.rst'], 'message': "[WIP] Change the structure of Ironic's developer documentation (Don't Merge)

We don't have OpenStack Documentation for kilo written by docs team.
So for Admins , we should keep the Install Guide etc for stable/kilo.

On the other hand, we should also keep the Developer Install Guide for master.

We should create a branch of guide for stable/kilo other than
what we maintain for master.

Change-Id: I19d6a1d4752813b8d42d675f956514d99230e2fe
"}]
commit_message:
[WIP] Change the structure of Ironic's developer documentation (Don't Merge)

We don't have OpenStack Documentation for kilo written by docs team.
So for Admins , we should keep the Install Guide etc for stable/kilo.

On the other hand, we should also keep the Developer Install Guide for master.

We should create a branch of guide for stable/kilo other than
what we maintain for master.

Change-Id: I19d6a1d4752813b8d42d675f956514d99230e2fe

commit_message:
Add alarm severity in alarm-history output

Info about alarm's severity is missing from
the detail column for creation and deletion
type of alarm-history call.

This fix adds that.

Change-Id: I669126596ef7391530e7822c2807ffca7c6a1de1
Closes-Bug: 1468295

revisions:
[{'number': 19, 'created': '2015-06-23 09:52:13.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/flows/manager/create_volume.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_volume.py'], 'message': "Fix weird change of volume status in re-scheduling

When create a volume failed as some exception, cinder will re-schedule the
creation request, the retry number is 3 in default.
But when re-scheduling, this volume's status was changed like this:

creating ----> error -----> creating------>error------>error/available

This is weird to user, since if this volume is in re-scheduling process,
it's status should always be creating, and then become error or available
at last.

Change-Id: I7a2d40585b5ef515a9400349a1397cba63278c78
Closes-Bug: #1445601
"}]
commit_message:
Fix weird change of volume status in re-scheduling

When create a volume failed as some exception, cinder will re-schedule the
creation request, the retry number is 3 in default.
But when re-scheduling, this volume's status was changed like this:

creating ----> error -----> creating------>error------>error/available

This is weird to user, since if this volume is in re-scheduling process,
it's status should always be creating, and then become error or available
at last.

Change-Id: I7a2d40585b5ef515a9400349a1397cba63278c78
Closes-Bug: #1445601

commit_message:
broken requirement qpid-python;python_version=='2.7'

This problem is relative to a gate fix job
https://github.com/openstack/heat/commit/
01e6713ee2dda7ef16dbe75b4aa4e29b02540703

but the requirement *qpid-python;python_version=='2.7'* seens
can't be satisfied.

I propose that we change back to *qpid-python*

Change-Id: I4dcfd5c7e434689f393790fb76118f4352d5d57b
Closes-Bug: #1471073

commit_message:
Rabbit config changes dont initiate a restart

Restart rabbit-server when the config files change. This required
the templates to be rendered from the post_install playbook to
prevent attempting to restart a service that had not yet been
installed.

Change-Id: I7c9ba030aa0e58d3fb5fa3cb6f17dd013f36471c
Closes-Bug: #1460115

commit_message:
Remove str() calls from compute clients

This patch removes unnecessary str() calls from compute clients
because all callers specify string values and we need to pass py3
tests when migrating them into tempest-lib.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I61b2b548c7c0a7c2d530cdde475065e8a45fd762

commit_message:
Make use of tempdir configuration

Some code around temp file does not honor the conf file setting
for tempdir. This patch aims to make use of this setting.

Change-Id: Ie4a0c2337be5811c06dd9aab45ff917b06669a7b
Closes-bug: 1428763

commit_message:
Squash Havana migration scripts

Havana is not supported now (https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Releases),
and the db migration scripts take time to execute. This patch squash DB
migration scripts for Havana (aka. 2013.2).

Change-Id: I1f8843462bba4c5775840e68cf24c5ddba0cc2b8
Closes-Bug: 1420103

commit_message:
Updated the clone process to exclude unneeded files

This commit changes the clone process to properly exclude files from the repo
clone play/task. This also ensures that when this play is used that all local
repos are an exact match to what is upstream.

Change-Id: I840997d6778f40a9007bce18df792c6b0c69c5eb
Closes-Bug: #1468567
(cherry picked from commit 955c851cddcc6876fc2b98e9cdf423688280d31c)

commit_message:
Fix ical scp upload

Apparently the target param for scp expects a folder, not a
destination filename (see
https://jenkins06.openstack.org/job/irc-meetings-publish/14/console)

Upload index.html and irc-meetings.ical into the root of the target
dir (ie /srv/yaml2ical/).

Change-Id: Ic5715dc7a1359807904f587f959ea36f377d1d24

subject: Add __bool__ for classes that implement __nonzero__
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-02 07:56:32.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/scheduler.py', 'heat/engine/dependencies.py'], 'message': 'Add __bool__ for classes that implement __nonzero__

__nonzero__ has been renamed to __bool__ in python3.4. So add the
__bool__ magic method that will in turn call the existing __nonzero__
method. This avoids the scheduler going into an infinte loop when
it checks for the no. of tasks remaining.

partial blueprint heat-python34-support

Change-Id: I5de554805a2af9abc15808427ce489720287f6b3
'}]
commit_message:
Add __bool__ for classes that implement __nonzero__

__nonzero__ has been renamed to __bool__ in python3.4. So add the
__bool__ magic method that will in turn call the existing __nonzero__
method. This avoids the scheduler going into an infinte loop when
it checks for the no. of tasks remaining.

partial blueprint heat-python34-support

Change-Id: I5de554805a2af9abc15808427ce489720287f6b3

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-07-02 16:58:18.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/templates/context_selection/_anti_clickjack.html', 'openstack_dashboard/templatetags/context_selection.py', 'openstack_dashboard/templates/base.html', 'doc/source/topics/settings.rst', 'openstack_dashboard/local/local_settings.py.example'], 'message': 'Add anti-ClickJack XFS hardening for old browsers

A Cross-Frame Scripting (XFS) vulnerability can allow an attacker to
load the vulnerable application inside an HTML iframe tag on a
malicious page. An attacker could use XFS to devise a Clickjacking
attack to conduct phishing, frame sniffing, social engineering or
Cross-Site Request Forgery attacks. Although many pages within Horizon
leverage the X-Frame-Options header with the recommended SAMEORIGIN
policy, some (still popular) older browsers don’t support this setting.
Namely, browsers older than IE 8 and Firefox 3.6.9 don’t recognize the
header and are thus vulnerable to an attack known as ClickJacking
unless an additional mitigating control is present.

To support legacy browsers, a suggested best practice is to add a
frame breaking script to the base/global template file.

Reference: http://tinyurl.com/anticlickjack

Change-Id: Ibd7acd0d7b4c4d58afcd59f025735bfc9e4c2957
Closes-Bug: 1461154
'}]
commit_message:
Add anti-ClickJack XFS hardening for old browsers

A Cross-Frame Scripting (XFS) vulnerability can allow an attacker to
load the vulnerable application inside an HTML iframe tag on a
malicious page. An attacker could use XFS to devise a Clickjacking
attack to conduct phishing, frame sniffing, social engineering or
Cross-Site Request Forgery attacks. Although many pages within Horizon
leverage the X-Frame-Options header with the recommended SAMEORIGIN
policy, some (still popular) older browsers don’t support this setting.
Namely, browsers older than IE 8 and Firefox 3.6.9 don’t recognize the
header and are thus vulnerable to an attack known as ClickJacking
unless an additional mitigating control is present.

To support legacy browsers, a suggested best practice is to add a
frame breaking script to the base/global template file.

Reference: http://tinyurl.com/anticlickjack

Change-Id: Ibd7acd0d7b4c4d58afcd59f025735bfc9e4c2957
Closes-Bug: 1461154

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-07-02 16:40:31.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/infra.yaml'], 'message': "Have irc-meetings-publish also publish directories

In irc-meetings reviews:
https://review.openstack.org/191234 ; and
https://review.openstack.org/193123

the tox job was changed from generating 2 files to also generating
the 'calendars' directory with an ics file for each meeting.

The public URL for the infra ical is:
http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/calendars/project-infrastructure-team-meeting.ics

Looking at a recent irc-meetings publish job:
https://jenkins03.openstack.org/job/irc-meetings-publish/11/console
the last few lines show
---
2015-06-22 04:08:38.688 | [SCP] Connecting to eavesdrop.openstack.org
2015-06-22 04:08:40.949 | [SCP] uploading file: '/srv/yaml2ical//index.html'
2015-06-22 04:08:41.077 | [SCP] uploading file: '/srv/yaml2ical//irc-meetings.ical'
2015-06-22 04:08:41.124 | Finished: SUCCESS
---

Which looks like the new calendars directory isn't being uploaded.

I believe that this will fix that such that we now publish:
output/index.html        => eavesdrop.o.o/index.html
output/irc-meetings.html => eavesdrop.o.o/irc-meetings.html
output/calendars         => eavesdrop.o.o/calendars
output/calendars/*       => eavesdrop.o.o/calendars/*

Change-Id: Ic968a1883d3942335547ed52948030f7f1f84add
Co-Authored-By: Joshua Hesketh <josh@nitrotech.org>
"}]
commit_message:
Have irc-meetings-publish also publish directories

In irc-meetings reviews:
https://review.openstack.org/191234 ; and
https://review.openstack.org/193123

the tox job was changed from generating 2 files to also generating
the 'calendars' directory with an ics file for each meeting.

The public URL for the infra ical is:
http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/calendars/project-infrastructure-team-meeting.ics

Looking at a recent irc-meetings publish job:
https://jenkins03.openstack.org/job/irc-meetings-publish/11/console
the last few lines show
---
2015-06-22 04:08:38.688 | [SCP] Connecting to eavesdrop.openstack.org
2015-06-22 04:08:40.949 | [SCP] uploading file: '/srv/yaml2ical//index.html'
2015-06-22 04:08:41.077 | [SCP] uploading file: '/srv/yaml2ical//irc-meetings.ical'
2015-06-22 04:08:41.124 | Finished: SUCCESS
---

Which looks like the new calendars directory isn't being uploaded.

I believe that this will fix that such that we now publish:
output/index.html        => eavesdrop.o.o/index.html
output/irc-meetings.html => eavesdrop.o.o/irc-meetings.html
output/calendars         => eavesdrop.o.o/calendars
output/calendars/*       => eavesdrop.o.o/calendars/*

Change-Id: Ic968a1883d3942335547ed52948030f7f1f84add
Co-Authored-By: Joshua Hesketh <josh@nitrotech.org>

commit_message:
Clear expired Django sessions regularly from DB

A random minute in the 21st hour UTC, daily, was chosen arbitrarily.
That it is run on a single arbitrary host from the set was done to
prevent unnecessary work being done until Bug #1424705 provides us with
a cleaner solution.

Adjusted to run once per day just to be sure that the operation doesn't
lock the table for a meaningful duration.

Making this configurable or tunable does not seem
to be necessary at this time.

Closes-Bug: #1466126

Conflicts:
	playbooks/roles/os_horizon/tasks/horizon_db_setup.yml

Change-Id: I87164926a4d6a65d3c9f733d625a2d4af91c2597
(cherry picked from commit 4ab949672428fda396d1d6a28149252dabc5655d)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-03 14:35:46.000000000', 'files': ['gerrit/acls/openstack/python-zaqarclient.config'], 'message': 'Rename zaqar-milestone group in gerrit to zaqar-stable-maint

I was having a hard time finding the stable branch maintenance team for
zaqar because they used a different naming convention for their group
from the rest of the projects:

https://review.openstack.org/#/admin/groups/?filter=stable

So rename the group to match the standard naming convention.

Change-Id: Ie2f9338d6b5a0f82d9d1d077398dcb7a68c681b2
'}]
commit_message:
Rename zaqar-milestone group in gerrit to zaqar-stable-maint

I was having a hard time finding the stable branch maintenance team for
zaqar because they used a different naming convention for their group
from the rest of the projects:

https://review.openstack.org/#/admin/groups/?filter=stable

So rename the group to match the standard naming convention.

Change-Id: Ie2f9338d6b5a0f82d9d1d077398dcb7a68c681b2

commit_message:
Hyper-V: Fixes Security Group Driver ICMPv6 rules

Security Group rules created with ethertype 'IPv6' and protocol 'icmp'
cannot be added by the Hyper-V Security Groups Driver, as it cannot add
rules with the protocol 'icmpv6'.

Creates stateless ICMPv6 security group rules properly.

Note: This is not a direct cherry-pick, as the Hyper-V Security Groups
Driver was refactored in the Kilo cycle.

(cherry picked from commit 1ea0f15e6a3b050e1301274496494d732d18f0d9)
Change-Id: Id49294965c7adb6d4fbc6c799e4ae7f30070bb71
Closes-Bug: #1466547

subject: Add port-security extension support
revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2015-07-02 04:43:52.000000000', 'files': ['midonet/neutron/tests/unit/test_midonet_plugin_v2.py', 'midonet/neutron/plugin_v2.py'], 'message': 'Add port-security extension support

This patch enables the port-security neutron extension in midonet.
It also adds the changes required for the port-security database
management.

This neutron extension adds a new field to the PORT object:
port_security_enabled. This field is a boolean which will
have the following effects on a port depending on its value:

TRUE: Allow the creation of anti-spoof protection (including
allowed-address-pairs) and security groups on this port.

FALSE: Block the creation of allowed address pairs and
security groups on this port, and do not create any
anti-spoof protection for this port. Setting
port_security_enabled to False will fail if there are
security groups or allowed address pairs associated with
the port. Also, associating security groups or allowed
address groups with a port will fail if port_security_enabled
is set to false.

Change-Id: I49ace9cc437601353d6a90f8d6eca8a20ebf3dc6
Signed-off-by: Joe Mills <joe@midokura.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add port-security extension support

This patch enables the port-security neutron extension in midonet.
It also adds the changes required for the port-security database
management.

This neutron extension adds a new field to the PORT object:
port_security_enabled. This field is a boolean which will
have the following effects on a port depending on its value:

TRUE: Allow the creation of anti-spoof protection (including
allowed-address-pairs) and security groups on this port.

FALSE: Block the creation of allowed address pairs and
security groups on this port, and do not create any
anti-spoof protection for this port. Setting
port_security_enabled to False will fail if there are
security groups or allowed address pairs associated with
the port. Also, associating security groups or allowed
address groups with a port will fail if port_security_enabled
is set to false.

Change-Id: I49ace9cc437601353d6a90f8d6eca8a20ebf3dc6
Signed-off-by: Joe Mills <joe@midokura.com>

commit_message:
Create automated job for sample configuration files

The keystone team updates the sample configuration file in it's
own patch, so to not stomp on other patches.

We've had to update the configuration files manually, but we
should create an automated job. Since it's just running
tox -e genconfig and checking diff output.

Change-Id: I0e294b857d9bbf73e7f9c0d0bdee61648fb999bd

commit_message:
Introduce Guru Meditation Reports into Heat

This commit integrates functionality from the `openstack.common.report`
module into Heat. This enables Heat services to receive SIGUSR1 and
print a Guru Meditation Report to stderr or file. The required modules
were added to 'openstack-common.conf' as well.

Change-Id: I36af98590e5556f012b0e9f79e21585e216b7280
Blueprint: guru-meditation-report
Co-Authored-By: huangtianhua <huangtianhua@huawei.com>

subject: Don't fail to build cache on missing bindep lists
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-03 00:15:58.000000000', 'files': ['nodepool/elements/cache-bindep/install.d/50-cache-pkgs'], 'message': "Don't fail to build cache on missing bindep lists

While git show is being used to build up a list of candidate
packages to cache, it can cause the cache hook to abort if it
returns nonzero because of a nonexistent bindep list file. Guard
that with a fallback to true so that the loop can continue
normally.

Change-Id: Ic3b773ad2e8efa2c450d37a0115355c0e95da853
"}]
commit_message:
Don't fail to build cache on missing bindep lists

While git show is being used to build up a list of candidate
packages to cache, it can cause the cache hook to abort if it
returns nonzero because of a nonexistent bindep list file. Guard
that with a fallback to true so that the loop can continue
normally.

Change-Id: Ic3b773ad2e8efa2c450d37a0115355c0e95da853

subject: Use beaker-puppet_install_helper to install puppet
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-30 21:02:32.000000000', 'files': ['Gemfile', 'spec/spec_helper_acceptance.rb'], 'message': "Use beaker-puppet_install_helper to install puppet

When running with BEAKER_provision=no, the following happens:

In Trusty: beaker is running dpkg with '--force' option so even
if Puppet is already installed, the return code will be 0.
In CentOS: beaker is running 'rpm -ivh' the second time and since
the package is already here, the return code will be 1.

Using the new puppet install helper will abort installing puppet
if BEAKER_provision is no, so tests will continue as normal.

Change-Id: I410ebcc23bdc27ae0e632d1f330cab374cbc8912
Co-Authored-By: Colleen Murphy <colleen@gazlene.net>
"}]
commit_message:
Use beaker-puppet_install_helper to install puppet

When running with BEAKER_provision=no, the following happens:

In Trusty: beaker is running dpkg with '--force' option so even
if Puppet is already installed, the return code will be 0.
In CentOS: beaker is running 'rpm -ivh' the second time and since
the package is already here, the return code will be 1.

Using the new puppet install helper will abort installing puppet
if BEAKER_provision is no, so tests will continue as normal.

Change-Id: I410ebcc23bdc27ae0e632d1f330cab374cbc8912
Co-Authored-By: Colleen Murphy <colleen@gazlene.net>

commit_message:
Fixes Hyper-V agent stateful security group rules

Hyper-V does not allow stateful ACLs with "ANY" protocol, meaning that
security group rules which allows "ANY" protocol must be split up
into separate rules for each protocol.
Also, Hyper-V does not allow stateful ICMP rules, which means ICMP rules
must be added both inbound and outbound.

Closes-Bug: #1362676

Change-Id: I0d4a6ebc6023ea616cf92539273b8b36a6b24ae0

commit_message:
QoS: db models and migration rules

This patch includes db models and migration rules for initial QoS objects.

Comparing to the spec, it adds two more service tables to maintain links
between networks and ports and their respective policies. We maintain
uniqueness as a unique constraint.

In some parallel world, we could have an additional field for networks
and ports that could be nullable to point to a policy. That said, it
breaks qos isolation a bit, and will also be a bit more painful if and
when we decide to spin out qos service pieces outside the tree.

blueprint quantum-qos-api

Co-Authored-By: Ramanjaneya <ramanjieee@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: vikram.choudhary <vikram.choudhary@huawei.com>
Co-Authored-By: Ihar Hrachyshka <ihrachys@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Miguel Angel Ajo <mangelajo@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I55a7dac602e2e770c21b6c7957430cb7115e5bdc

commit_message:
Allow users to configure blacklist of URI schemes

It will help to shortcircuit the checks at Glance's level,
but themselves should check this and have security related options.
At the same time, it is easy to allow users to download and delete file which
they want.

From the security side, you have to know how to configure to allow and forbid
different users to do what they want. some users want to add a new URI scheme
allowed by the glance_store after all.

Related-Bug: 1408663

Change-Id: I417e096ef94c5d62d0a7bed64ce685cf5a09939f

subject: Backward-compatible branch list for bindep element
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-02 23:44:16.000000000', 'files': ['nodepool/elements/cache-bindep/install.d/50-cache-pkgs'], 'message': 'Backward-compatible branch list for bindep element

The version of git on CentOS 6.x is too ancient to support git
branch --list which is necessary to disambiguate -r with a name
pattern. Instead just list all remote branches and filter with grep
like a good Neanderthal.

Change-Id: I4e673e86acb70c205d159e22b5864cf60ae831df
'}]
commit_message:
Backward-compatible branch list for bindep element

The version of git on CentOS 6.x is too ancient to support git
branch --list which is necessary to disambiguate -r with a name
pattern. Instead just list all remote branches and filter with grep
like a good Neanderthal.

Change-Id: I4e673e86acb70c205d159e22b5864cf60ae831df

commit_message:
Use v3 API when adding group roles

Groups only exist in the v3 identity API and so we must specify
--os-identity-api-version in these commands.

This command has no output (bug?) so we re-run the query to get the
added id.

Change-Id: I7b8d06f97a417346f0875b02f4cff97a45821ea9
Closes-Bug: #1470668

revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2015-07-01 23:20:55.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/virt/test_hardware.py', 'nova/scheduler/utils.py', 'nova/tests/unit/conductor/test_conductor.py', 'nova/objects/instance.py', 'nova/tests/unit/objects/test_instance.py', 'nova/compute/resource_tracker.py'], 'message': "Remove compat_instance()

This was added to support older RPC calls where instance_properties had some
flavor stuff embedded in system_metadata. That is not (AFAIK) still required
after the move to compute RPC v4.0 and the dropping of v3.0 support.

This is required to drop flavors-in-sysmeta compatibility across the board.

Note that this attempts to keep the scheduler's request_spec contract for
RPC by stashing old-style flavor info into the system_metadata of the
instance_properties if we have a full flavor. We don't think it's ever
actually used (at least by in-tree code), but this change attempts to be
well-behaved in this regard.

Change-Id: I246b23ef48227df7e775018c116afe656a0d1633
"}]
commit_message:
Remove compat_instance()

This was added to support older RPC calls where instance_properties had some
flavor stuff embedded in system_metadata. That is not (AFAIK) still required
after the move to compute RPC v4.0 and the dropping of v3.0 support.

This is required to drop flavors-in-sysmeta compatibility across the board.

Note that this attempts to keep the scheduler's request_spec contract for
RPC by stashing old-style flavor info into the system_metadata of the
instance_properties if we have a full flavor. We don't think it's ever
actually used (at least by in-tree code), but this change attempts to be
well-behaved in this regard.

Change-Id: I246b23ef48227df7e775018c116afe656a0d1633

subject: Rename bindep package caching element for conflict
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-02 23:05:16.000000000', 'files': ['nodepool/elements/cache-bindep/install.d/50-cache-pkgs'], 'message': "Rename bindep package caching element for conflict

A quirk of diskimage-builder is that no two elements you compose are
allowed to have parts with the same filename. Rename cache-bindep's
install.d/50-download-pkgs so that it doesn't conflict with the one
of the same name in the cache-devstack element.

Change-Id: I5709147fc5bd4c06fb1bba8ea0e068c0eda7d010
"}]
commit_message:
Rename bindep package caching element for conflict

A quirk of diskimage-builder is that no two elements you compose are
allowed to have parts with the same filename. Rename cache-bindep's
install.d/50-download-pkgs so that it doesn't conflict with the one
of the same name in the cache-devstack element.

Change-Id: I5709147fc5bd4c06fb1bba8ea0e068c0eda7d010

commit_message:
Specific changes into settings of glance

This change adds:
 - The ability to override keystone user/tenant for glance
 - The ability to override the swift large object size setting
 - The ability to override the glance pipeline setting
 - The ability to override the glance show image direct url setting

Partial blueprint: detach-components-from-controllers

Change-Id: I19ae77ccc1e9a4d5ecabf153ed84751e21652a3a
Co-Authored-By: Dmitrii Kabanov <dkabanov@mirantis.com>

subject: Angular translation via babel (singular only)
revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2015-07-02 01:16:00.000000000', 'files': ['run_tests.sh', 'horizon/test/tests/utils.py', 'tools/with_venv.sh', 'babel-djangojs.cfg', 'horizon/utils/babel_extract_angular.py'], 'message': "Angular translation via babel (singular only) An approach to i18n for Angular HTML templates using babel. This patch allows only singular translation. Plurals and context will be addressed in subsequent patches. Based on Thai Tran's work at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/187321 This patch implements a custom extractor in horizon/utils/babel_extract_angular.py. pybabel really wants this to be a package installed into site-packages. I have not done this so as to avoid introducing a dependency on another change to global requirements just yet. I will upload a package to pypi in parallel so that we can start using it in the future. For now, I have had to modify tools/with_venv.sh to add horizon to the PYTHONPATH. This is less than ideal but seemed to be the least worst option. Steps to verify that it works: 1. Create a new html file in horizon/static or openstack_dashboard/static 2. Add something like
hello world!
to the html To test interpolation add something like:
hello {$name$}!
3. Run ./run_tests.sh --makemessages 4. Inspect your djangojs.po file, it should be there. The following steps are optional: 5. Run ./run_tests.sh --pseudo de 6. Run ./run_tests.sh --compilemessages 7. Go to http://localhost:8000/settings 8. Change Language to Deutsch 9. Go to http://localhost:8000/i18n/js/horizon+openstack_dashboard 10. Your translated text should be there as well. Note: There are now unit tests as well. Partially-Implements: blueprint angular-translate-makemessages Depends on: If4352aba01ce0ca6337f590c0689d8fe9f0867c8 Change-Id: I26d4fef8646d5f038918cd3376dbbdbef37eb603 "}]
commit_message:
Angular translation via babel (singular only) An approach to i18n for Angular HTML templates using babel. This patch allows only singular translation. Plurals and context will be addressed in subsequent patches. Based on Thai Tran's work at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/187321 This patch implements a custom extractor in horizon/utils/babel_extract_angular.py. pybabel really wants this to be a package installed into site-packages. I have not done this so as to avoid introducing a dependency on another change to global requirements just yet. I will upload a package to pypi in parallel so that we can start using it in the future. For now, I have had to modify tools/with_venv.sh to add horizon to the PYTHONPATH. This is less than ideal but seemed to be the least worst option. Steps to verify that it works: 1. Create a new html file in horizon/static or openstack_dashboard/static 2. Add something like
hello world!
to the html To test interpolation add something like:
hello {$name$}!
3. Run ./run_tests.sh --makemessages 4. Inspect your djangojs.po file, it should be there. The following steps are optional: 5. Run ./run_tests.sh --pseudo de 6. Run ./run_tests.sh --compilemessages 7. Go to http://localhost:8000/settings 8. Change Language to Deutsch 9. Go to http://localhost:8000/i18n/js/horizon+openstack_dashboard 10. Your translated text should be there as well. Note: There are now unit tests as well. commit_message:
Disable keepalived process in keepalived func test

Previously, keepalived process itself was disabled that lead to
respawning of keepalived by KeepalivedManager. This patch disables
KeepalivedManager in cleanup thus no respawn happens.

Closes-Bug: #1466873

Conflicts:
	neutron/tests/functional/agent/linux/test_keepalived.py

Change-Id: If5524116e5d4fc41600920d31481282c5b797f7b
(cherry picked from commit b336b7c438f3f5d4ee8d23d6bb2d2cf8fe1657f4)

revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2015-07-02 18:20:27.000000000', 'files': ['examples/wildcard-injection.py', 'bandit/config/bandit.yaml', 'examples/utils-shell.py', 'examples/partial_path_process.py', 'examples/skip.py', 'examples/os-startfile.py', 'docs/partial_paths.md', 'examples/imports-aliases.py', 'examples/popen_wrappers.py', 'examples/subprocess_shell.py', 'tests/test_functional.py', 'bandit/plugins/injection_shell.py', 'examples/os_system.py'], 'message': 'Adding a test for partial paths in exec functions

When using functions like subprocess.Popen etc to launch an
external executable, the full path should be given. This prevents
an attacker from manipulting the search path or placing a bogus
executable that will be launched instead of the intended one.

Change-Id: I4a11f988bc3e954331ab0f0902ea849c6ec31888
'}]
commit_message:
Adding a test for partial paths in exec functions

When using functions like subprocess.Popen etc to launch an
external executable, the full path should be given. This prevents
an attacker from manipulting the search path or placing a bogus
executable that will be launched instead of the intended one.

Change-Id: I4a11f988bc3e954331ab0f0902ea849c6ec31888

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-03 19:03:12.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/l3_hamode_db.py'], 'message': 'HA network requires port_security_enabled to be set

if port_security_enabled is not set on the ha_network
when   ha routers are being created, the
router creation will fail because the code will
throw an exception before it is done processing the
network creation.
The network gets created but from then on, every
time the code does something with the network, like
attaching to an ha router, OR neutron net-list, the
exception gets thrown and is reported as an internal errror.
It also becomes impossible to delete the ha network without
actually changing the code.

Change-Id: Icf8bc5b5a4a5d4de6f96992c24ac1169ba98a96a
Closes-Bug: #1461647
'}]
commit_message:
HA network requires port_security_enabled to be set

if port_security_enabled is not set on the ha_network
when   ha routers are being created, the
router creation will fail because the code will
throw an exception before it is done processing the
network creation.
The network gets created but from then on, every
time the code does something with the network, like
attaching to an ha router, OR neutron net-list, the
exception gets thrown and is reported as an internal errror.
It also becomes impossible to delete the ha network without
actually changing the code.

Change-Id: Icf8bc5b5a4a5d4de6f96992c24ac1169ba98a96a
Closes-Bug: #1461647

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1, 'name': 'James E. Blair', 'email': 'jim@acmegating.com', 'username': 'corvus'}, {'_account_id': 2, 'name': 'Monty Taylor', 'email': 'mordred@inaugust.com', 'username': 'mordred'}, {'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5263, 'name': 'Jeremy Stanley', 'display_name': 'fungi', 'email': 'fungi@yuggoth.org', 'username': 'fungi', 'status': 'missing, presumed fed'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-06-24 18:56:18.000000000', 'files': ['nodepool/elements/cache-bindep/README.rst', 'nodepool/elements/cache-bindep/install.d/50-download-pkgs', 'nodepool/elements/cache-bindep/install.d/40-install-bindep', 'nodepool/elements/cache-bindep/element-deps'], 'message': 'Pre-cache distro packages from bindep lists

We intend to use bindep to tell us what distro packages should be
installed at job run-time, so need to similarly identify those in
such a way that they can be cached on our worker images.

Install the latest bindep release from PyPI into /usr/bindep-env
(consistent with the way we provide virtualenvs for access to
zuul-cloner and libraries used by our log uploads to swift).
Concatenate bindep lists from all branches of every hosted Git repo
along with our fallback list in project-config. Run bindep to render
them into a platform-specific manifest of package names and feed
that to the relevant package management tool for the platform to
download this set into the package cache.

Note that similar tooling is not applied to snapshot nodes, since we
only intend to run jobs which use bindep on diskimage-builder
created nodes.

Change-Id: I0c408fee35dfe9b4f700c51565bfaae0a3d03beb
'}]
commit_message:
Pre-cache distro packages from bindep lists

We intend to use bindep to tell us what distro packages should be
installed at job run-time, so need to similarly identify those in
such a way that they can be cached on our worker images.

Install the latest bindep release from PyPI into /usr/bindep-env
(consistent with the way we provide virtualenvs for access to
zuul-cloner and libraries used by our log uploads to swift).
Concatenate bindep lists from all branches of every hosted Git repo
along with our fallback list in project-config. Run bindep to render
them into a platform-specific manifest of package names and feed
that to the relevant package management tool for the platform to
download this set into the package cache.

Note that similar tooling is not applied to snapshot nodes, since we
only intend to run jobs which use bindep on diskimage-builder
created nodes.

Change-Id: I0c408fee35dfe9b4f700c51565bfaae0a3d03beb

commit_message:
In-tree grenade support for Heat

The following implements in tree support for grenade upgrade testing
for heat. It includes the expected directory structure to be used for
the external plugin.

For now, we create a simple OS::Heat::RandomString resource
and check whether the stack survives the upgrade.
We should add better tests for upgrades in the future.

Co-Authored-By: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Sergey Kraynev <skraynev@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Emilien Macchi <emilien.macchi@enovance.com>

partial blueprint upgrade-tests

Change-Id: I0847004a8ac023a113cabaee46896abc823a01da

commit_message:
JSCS Cleanup - style cleanup for modal factory

Per the style guide:

Factory and service should both just be .service.js

https://github.com/johnpapa/angular-styleguide#style-y121

Notice the comment:
/**
 * recommended
 */
// services/factories
logger.service.js
logger.service.spec.js

And discussion here:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/182243
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/195660

Change-Id: I361f38f0fb1989190fe1b3e75f224d4c46aafbf4
Partially-Implements: blueprint jscs-cleanup

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-12 12:58:39.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/ipam/subnet_alloc.py'], 'message': "Ensure non-overlapping cidrs in subnetpools without galera

_get_allocated_cidrs[1] locks only allocated subnets in a subnetpool
(with mysql/postgresql at least). It ensures we don't allocate a cidr
overlapping with existent cidrs but nothing disallows a concurrent
subnet allocation to create a subnet in the same subnetpool.

This change replaces the lock on subnetpool subnets by a lock on the
subnetpool itself. It disallows to allocate concurrently 2 subnets in
the same subnetpool and ensure non-overlapping cidrs in the same
subnetpool.

Moreover this change solves a trouble with postgresql which disallows
to lock an empty select with an outer join: it happens on first subnet
allocation in a subnetpool when no specific cidr is provided. Moving
the lock ensures the lock is done on a non-empty select.

But this change does not ensure non-overlapping cidrs in subnetpools
with galera because galera doesn't support SELECT FOR UPDATE locks. A
follow-up change will (try to?) remove locks from subnet allocation[1]
in order to ensure non-overlapping cidrs in subnetpools also with galera.

[1] in neutron.ipam.subnet_alloc.SubnetAllocator

Closes-Bug: #1451558
Partial-Bug: #1451576
Change-Id: I73854f9863f44621ae0d89c5dc4893ccc16d07e4
(cherry picked from commit 3682e3391f188845d0c7f382f0ccd4b38db3904e)
Conflicts:
	neutron/ipam/subnet_alloc.py
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure non-overlapping cidrs in subnetpools without galera

_get_allocated_cidrs[1] locks only allocated subnets in a subnetpool
(with mysql/postgresql at least). It ensures we don't allocate a cidr
overlapping with existent cidrs but nothing disallows a concurrent
subnet allocation to create a subnet in the same subnetpool.

This change replaces the lock on subnetpool subnets by a lock on the
subnetpool itself. It disallows to allocate concurrently 2 subnets in
the same subnetpool and ensure non-overlapping cidrs in the same
subnetpool.

Moreover this change solves a trouble with postgresql which disallows
to lock an empty select with an outer join: it happens on first subnet
allocation in a subnetpool when no specific cidr is provided. Moving
the lock ensures the lock is done on a non-empty select.

But this change does not ensure non-overlapping cidrs in subnetpools
with galera because galera doesn't support SELECT FOR UPDATE locks. A
follow-up change will (try to?) remove locks from subnet allocation[1]
in order to ensure non-overlapping cidrs in subnetpools also with galera.

[1] in neutron.ipam.subnet_alloc.SubnetAllocator

Closes-Bug: #1451558
Partial-Bug: #1451576
Change-Id: I73854f9863f44621ae0d89c5dc4893ccc16d07e4
(cherry picked from commit 3682e3391f188845d0c7f382f0ccd4b38db3904e)
Conflicts:
	neutron/ipam/subnet_alloc.py

commit_message:
Add block name to switch config options for MLX plug-ins.

In the INI files, the switch_names option uses a dynamic
value to determine the block names for the switch options.
In order to create proper config option reference docs,
there needs to be an example block name for the switch
options.

Change-Id: Ic5bf6de02ba1b7d1bc90ee29a5a0570fb45b9956
Closes-Bug: #1442357
(cherry picked from commit 594353722ccba27d19c693c2f77905758e46223a)

commit_message:
Avoid double-hopping deletes for security group rules

There is no need to get and delete; we can delete with one bullet.
This will most likely have quite a decent performance benefit overall.

The patch preserves the existing logic of raising and error on the missing
element; a test was added to spur up the coverage.

Related-bug: #1444112

Change-Id: Iaef77bd3f7775ed91d374838fb5488d925b4062c
(cherry picked from commit 05a9f16257c2953bf40d11ca2a2f9651ba4e86b2)

subject: Create a devstack plugin for ceilometer
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-06-29 09:40:55.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/apache-ceilometer.template', 'devstack/files/rpms/ceilometer', 'devstack/plugin.sh', 'devstack/settings'], 'message': "Create a devstack plugin for ceilometer

This is mostly a straight port of devstack:lib/ceilometer with some
minor cleanups in the code. Notable changes include:

* default values are moved to devstack/settings
* all services provided by ceilometer are turned on by default, use
  disable_service to turn them off
* mongod smallfiles is no longer used as it is not (apparently) used
  with deb-based installs and there's a lot of water under the
  bridge since then, so let's remove the complexity
* config handling is broken down into smaller sub-functions
* explicitly require python redis driver if needed, otherwise it
  will not be available in a virtualenv
* install_ceilometermiddleware is not included, it is moved to
  lib/swift

Change-Id: If36faa72b8c8d0f58a4ab5d02ed9cf92de3583b7
"}]
commit_message:
Create a devstack plugin for ceilometer

This is mostly a straight port of devstack:lib/ceilometer with some
minor cleanups in the code. Notable changes include:

* default values are moved to devstack/settings
* all services provided by ceilometer are turned on by default, use
  disable_service to turn them off
* mongod smallfiles is no longer used as it is not (apparently) used
  with deb-based installs and there's a lot of water under the
  bridge since then, so let's remove the complexity
* config handling is broken down into smaller sub-functions
* explicitly require python redis driver if needed, otherwise it
  will not be available in a virtualenv
* install_ceilometermiddleware is not included, it is moved to
  lib/swift

Change-Id: If36faa72b8c8d0f58a4ab5d02ed9cf92de3583b7

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-06-30 14:55:40.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/os_keystone/templates/keystone-fernet-rotate.sh.j2', 'playbooks/roles/os_keystone/templates/keystone.conf.j2', 'playbooks/roles/os_keystone/tasks/keystone_key_setup.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_keystone/tasks/keystone_key_distribute.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_keystone/tasks/keystone_fernet_keys_autorotate.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_keystone/tasks/keystone_key_store.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_keystone/tasks/keystone_key_create.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_keystone/tasks/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_keystone/tasks/keystone_fernet.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_keystone/tasks/keystone_pre_install.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_keystone/tasks/keystone_fernet_keys_fetch.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_keystone/defaults/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_keystone/tasks/keystone_fernet_keys_distribute.yml'], 'message': 'Updated default fernet key usage

This change makes the use of fernet tokens production ready. The changes are
as follows:
  * Ensures that the keys are rotated on every playbook execution
  * Removes the need to sync keys back to a deployment host when distributing
    them to other keystone hosts.
  * Creates an autonomous key rotation process that can rotate on the following
    intervals [reboot, yearly, annually, monthly, weekly, daily, hourly] to all
    hosts from any keystone fernet host.
  * Fixes the section in `keystone.conf` which was named "fernet_key" instead
    of "fernet_token".

Change-Id: I50f6a852930728631f5c681a8aa0f1321d7424ac
Related-Bug: #1463569
Closes-Bug: #1468256
'}]
commit_message:
Updated default fernet key usage

This change makes the use of fernet tokens production ready. The changes are
as follows:
  * Ensures that the keys are rotated on every playbook execution
  * Removes the need to sync keys back to a deployment host when distributing
    them to other keystone hosts.
  * Creates an autonomous key rotation process that can rotate on the following
    intervals [reboot, yearly, annually, monthly, weekly, daily, hourly] to all
    hosts from any keystone fernet host.
  * Fixes the section in `keystone.conf` which was named "fernet_key" instead
    of "fernet_token".

Change-Id: I50f6a852930728631f5c681a8aa0f1321d7424ac
Related-Bug: #1463569
Closes-Bug: #1468256

commit_message:
Provide work around for 0.0.0.0/0 ::/0 for ipset

Previously, the ipset_manager would pass in 0.0.0.0/0 or ::/0 if
these addresses were inputted as allowed address pairs. This causes
ipset to raise an error as it does not work with zero prefix sizes.
To solve this problem we use two ipset rules to represent this:

Ipv4: 0.0.0.0/1 and 128.0.0.1/1
IPv6: ::/1' and '8000::/1

All of this logic is handled via _sanitize_addresses() in the ipset_manager
which is called to convert the input.

Conflicts:
	neutron/agent/linux/ipset_manager.py
	neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_ipset_manager.py

Change-Id: I8c6a08e0cf3b5b5386fe03af9f2174c666b8ac75
Closes-bug: 1461054

The glance_api_servers points to a list of glance_api_servers for both
cinder and nova. This causes "nova image-list" to fail when glance api
servers are unavailable. Pointing to the LB VIP works as intended, so
removing this var in favour of the "host/port" vars ensures that only
the glance servers that are available are used.

glance_api_servers is still available and if specified will be used in
favour of host/port, but default it is commented out and the host/port

Change-Id: I6794a1a266d22944be8d5634ee0c0ce6cd9f2c59

commit_message:
Default to use host/port for glance_api_servers

The glance_api_servers points to a list of glance_api_servers for both
cinder and nova. This causes "nova image-list" to fail when glance api
servers are unavailable. Pointing to the LB VIP works as intended, so
removing this var in favour of the "host/port" vars ensures that only
the glance servers that are available are used.

glance_api_servers is still available and if specified will be used in
favour of host/port, but default it is commented out and the host/port
will be used - which uses the internal_lb_vip_address and default
glance_api_service_port.

Change-Id: I6794a1a266d22944be8d5634ee0c0ce6cd9f2c59
Closes-Bug: #1461245
(cherry picked from commit d8b4cf9e790f812b2cfafb237d5909e46c3744d9)

subject: Already dead process tolerance in unstack.sh
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-01 10:29:03.000000000', 'files': ['lib/neutron_plugins/services/loadbalancer', 'functions-common', 'lib/swift'], 'message': 'Already dead process tolerance in unstack.sh

The gate/updown.sh calls the unstack.sh with
-ex option. Normally we do not use -e with unstack.sh.

The unstack.sh can fail if the service already stopped,
and it also can have flaky failures on the gate.

For example the stop_swift function tries to kill swift in two
different ways, and if the first one succeeds before the 2th attempt
the pkill fails the whole unstack.sh.

This change accepts kill failure.
Normally the kill can fail if the process does not exits,
or when you do not have permission to the kill operation.

Since the permission issue is very unlikely in our case,
this change does not tries to distinguish the two operation.

The behavior of the unstack.sh wen you are not using -ex should
not be changed by this change.

Change-Id: I64bf3cbe1b60c96f5b271dcfb620c3d4b50de26b
'}]
commit_message:
Already dead process tolerance in unstack.sh

The gate/updown.sh calls the unstack.sh with
-ex option. Normally we do not use -e with unstack.sh.

The unstack.sh can fail if the service already stopped,
and it also can have flaky failures on the gate.

For example the stop_swift function tries to kill swift in two
different ways, and if the first one succeeds before the 2th attempt
the pkill fails the whole unstack.sh.

This change accepts kill failure.
Normally the kill can fail if the process does not exits,
or when you do not have permission to the kill operation.

Since the permission issue is very unlikely in our case,
this change does not tries to distinguish the two operation.

The behavior of the unstack.sh wen you are not using -ex should
not be changed by this change.

Change-Id: I64bf3cbe1b60c96f5b271dcfb620c3d4b50de26b

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-23 11:52:04.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/api/glance.py'], 'message': 'Handle errors during glance image updates correctly

Before an UnboundLocalError would occur in case an error would happen
during image updates, because of incorrect referencing of a variable.
Moreover the error was muted by exceptions.handle with ignore=True,
and could result in an incorrect success message.
This change removes references to unused image variable and allows
exceptions to be handled by the function, that calls image_update.

Change-Id: I35ea98a146690565582dd9beea62941f97d32474
Closes-Bug: #1464991
(cherry picked from commit 7eb4e3595c5a30f95d976ea84493453730f3c806)
'}]
commit_message:
Handle errors during glance image updates correctly

Before an UnboundLocalError would occur in case an error would happen
during image updates, because of incorrect referencing of a variable.
Moreover the error was muted by exceptions.handle with ignore=True,
and could result in an incorrect success message.
This change removes references to unused image variable and allows
exceptions to be handled by the function, that calls image_update.

Change-Id: I35ea98a146690565582dd9beea62941f97d32474
Closes-Bug: #1464991
(cherry picked from commit 7eb4e3595c5a30f95d976ea84493453730f3c806)

commit_message:
remove non RabbitMQ messaging

Part of what was decided at summit is devstack needs to return to a
more opinionated stance, the following removes support for non
RabbitMQ messaging. RabbitMQ is used by over 95% of our community
(statistically all of it), so it's a pretty clear line to draw that
this shouldn't be in tree.

iniset_rpc_backend will be our stable hook for other projects that
want to implement this out of tree. The burden on creating those out
of tree plugins will be on those that wish to support those
alternative stacks.

Change-Id: I8073a895c03ec927a2598eff6c2f01e5c82606fc

This patch converts the ResourceTracker compute_node property
to be a ComputeNode object. A number of fields automatically
take care of mapping their values to a db format, so some of the
code creating json strings goes away with this change.

The scheduler client report code is simplified by the change

Note that this change naturally required modification to a
number of tests in test_tracker, test_resource_tracker and
test_client to cater for objects instead of dicts. Some of these
tests were using incorrect values or arbitrary key names that do

Change-Id: I2279f01ad55083c31c663242a2a60a48191e88c3
'}]
commit_message:
Convert RT compute_node to be a ComputeNode object

This patch converts the ResourceTracker compute_node property
to be a ComputeNode object. A number of fields automatically
take care of mapping their values to a db format, so some of the
code creating json strings goes away with this change.

The scheduler client report code is simplified by the change
to use a ComputeNode object.

Note that this change naturally required modification to a
number of tests in test_tracker, test_resource_tracker and
test_client to cater for objects instead of dicts. Some of these
tests were using incorrect values or arbitrary key names that do
not exist as ComputeNode fields, so they had to be corrected to
conform to the type checking of the ComputeNode object.

part of blueprint make-resource-tracker-use-objects

Change-Id: I2279f01ad55083c31c663242a2a60a48191e88c3

commit_message:
Fix failing unit tests under py34

When running the unit tests under Python >= 3.4.2, several of them
fail with "TypeError: 'xxx' object is not iterable".  This is due to a
bug in mock: http://bugs.python.org/issue23661.

The workaround to this bug is to make side effects that are exceptions
iterable.  This change makes the unit tests work on both py27 and py34.

Change-Id: I4bcda02bb5756fea2a8daecc238ef7439ad43700
Partial-Bug: #1463867

The patch adds cleanup on router delete for routers which
are unknown to agent. This should cover the case when router is
deleted during resync on agent init.

Functional tests were updated and now handle 3 cases for l3 sync:
 - no routers were deleted during agent downtime,
 - some routers were deleted during agent downtime

Closes-Bug: #1464238

commit_message:
l3 agent: do router cleanup for unknown routers

The patch adds cleanup on router delete for routers which
are unknown to agent. This should cover the case when router is
deleted during resync on agent init.

Functional tests were updated and now handle 3 cases for l3 sync:
 - no routers were deleted during agent downtime,
 - some routers were deleted during agent downtime
 - some routers were deleted during agent resync

Closes-Bug: #1464238
Change-Id: Id98111849fa88d6807f757864187b059c491aaac

commit_message:
Document only exectuables in phase dirs policy

Having data files in the phase subdirs is an easy source of confusion
in reviews (especially when the data file is a script) and theres really
no reason to be putting data files there at this point. Lets make a
convention out of not doing this.

Change-Id: I99571a2a49e14e8c709af20f6d13d662ac745eb4

commit_message:
Update pbr version to match global requirements

The version of pbr we were using was having trouble parsing a new version
identifier for python-qpid, We have the pbr version hardcoded in many
places so update it to match whats currently in global-requirements.

Fixes bug #1470871
Change-Id: Ia5aec472555ad1368684b224a55c29242ae40b58

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-07-01 02:49:21.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/db/test_migrations.py', 'nova/tests/fixtures.py', 'nova/tests/unit/test_fixtures.py'], 'message': 'Block subtractive operations in migrations for Kilo and beyond

In Kilo, we made a point to not allow any subtractive DB migrations. That
gave us a lot of flexibility for upgrades from Juno. Reviewers did the
awesome job of keeping to that plan. However, we need a mechanical filter
to prevent regressions. This adds that in the form of a banned-ops fixture
in test_migrations.

It excludes migrations from pre-Kilo times, as well as excludes a few
migrations that are already in place and do reaspnable things.
In general, we need to be extremely careful about letting migrations
put themselves on the exclusion list, so I added scary words around it.

Change-Id: Iefe678d0aeb1ad898fc5a0cee10fd55ccb7e06db
'}]
commit_message:
Block subtractive operations in migrations for Kilo and beyond

In Kilo, we made a point to not allow any subtractive DB migrations. That
gave us a lot of flexibility for upgrades from Juno. Reviewers did the
awesome job of keeping to that plan. However, we need a mechanical filter
to prevent regressions. This adds that in the form of a banned-ops fixture
in test_migrations.

It excludes migrations from pre-Kilo times, as well as excludes a few
migrations that are already in place and do reaspnable things.
In general, we need to be extremely careful about letting migrations
put themselves on the exclusion list, so I added scary words around it.

Change-Id: Iefe678d0aeb1ad898fc5a0cee10fd55ccb7e06db

commit_message:
Update requirements

- current global requirements
- merge py3 req files into markers

The one eww moment is the -e line for glance store, which only got in
because the infra check-requirements job wasn't checking -py3 files at
all until recently.

commit_message:
Cleanup the specs repo

This commit bakes several cleanups into one patch. First it clearly
separates devstack and tempest specs by creating a separate tempest
subdir for specs. The next step is moving all implemented specs/bps
into the implemented dir to indicate this. The last is deleting specs
which were outdated and never implemented.

Change-Id: I86331ac279b6a9cdb94ed4c43e5b0c41697e6a7d

commit_message:
Replace xrange() with six.moves.range()

Patch generated by the xrange operation of the sixer tool:
https://pypi.python.org/pypi/sixer

Manual changes:

* Fix indentation for pep8 checks
* Fix TestGreenthreadSafeIterator.test_access_is_serialized of
  test.unit.common.test_utils:
  replace range(1, 11) with list(range(1, 11))
* Fix UnsafeXrange docstring, revert change

Change-Id: Icb7e26135c5e57b5302b8bfe066b33cafe69fe4d

subject: Use beaker-puppet_install_helper to install puppet
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-30 21:02:29.000000000', 'files': ['Gemfile', 'spec/spec_helper_acceptance.rb'], 'message': "Use beaker-puppet_install_helper to install puppet

When running with BEAKER_provision=no, the following happens:

In Trusty: beaker is running dpkg with '--force' option so even
if Puppet is already installed, the return code will be 0.
In CentOS: beaker is running 'rpm -ivh' the second time and since
the package is already here, the return code will be 1.

Using the new puppet install helper will abort installing puppet
if BEAKER_provision is no, so tests will continue as normal.

Change-Id: If77faa655f1831a7c9ad2c8d5c42ea712a4b651d
Co-Authored-By: Colleen Murphy <colleen@gazlene.net>
"}]
commit_message:
Use beaker-puppet_install_helper to install puppet

When running with BEAKER_provision=no, the following happens:

In Trusty: beaker is running dpkg with '--force' option so even
if Puppet is already installed, the return code will be 0.
In CentOS: beaker is running 'rpm -ivh' the second time and since
the package is already here, the return code will be 1.

Using the new puppet install helper will abort installing puppet
if BEAKER_provision is no, so tests will continue as normal.

Change-Id: If77faa655f1831a7c9ad2c8d5c42ea712a4b651d
Co-Authored-By: Colleen Murphy <colleen@gazlene.net>

commit_message:
Use beaker-puppet_install_helper to install puppet

When running with BEAKER_provision=no, the following happens:

In Trusty: beaker is running dpkg with '--force' option so even
if Puppet is already installed, the return code will be 0.
In CentOS: beaker is running 'rpm -ivh' the second time and since
the package is already here, the return code will be 1.

Using the new puppet install helper will abort installing puppet
if BEAKER_provision is no, so tests will continue as normal.

Change-Id: Id9c974e53cf29561ba4e94df5b82efff24293ad0
Co-Authored-By: Colleen Murphy <colleen@gazlene.net>

commit_message:
Theming Mechanism now supports 3rd party themes

In order to fascilate the bulk of the CSS Reorg effort, it will be extremely
beneficial to quickly toggle between many different themes in order to validate
proper cascading inheritance.  This work prompted the following example theme.

The 'material' theme gives an example of how to make use of a 3rd party theme
using the theming functionality.  In addition to incorporating a theme,
loaded as a static asset using requirements.txt, it also gives examples of how
to cleanly override styles, variables, icon fonts and Django templates.

Change-Id: I00bbf11e72ad8aa8d2c43f0a76556e047c6cf1fa
Partially-Implements: blueprint horizon-theme-css-reorg

Closes-Bug: #1465440

commit_message:
Remove 'shared' from Neutron Firewall table

Neutron FWaaS firewall object does not support 'shared' attribute
at now and 'shared' attribute is not included in API response.
This commmit removes 'shared' attribute for firewall object.
For more detail of the background, please see the bug report.

Note that 'shared' attributes for firewall rule and policy
are supported. This commit only affect the firewall object.

Change-Id: I5787529395e0005ce1efee48beb6f0f688c1c736
Closes-Bug: #1465440

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-26 08:46:16.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/static/horizon/js/horizon.datepickers.js', 'openstack_dashboard/static/dashboard/scss/horizon.scss', 'openstack_dashboard/utils/metering.py', 'horizon/templates/horizon/_scripts.html', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/metering/forms.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/metering/templates/metering/_daily.html', 'openstack_dashboard/test/tests/utils.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/metering/templates/metering/stats.html', 'horizon/static/horizon/js/horizon.d3linechart.js', 'horizon/static/horizon/js/horizon.metering.js'], 'message': 'Fix date pickers in metering modal

The metering forms were using the date picker functionality from the
d3 line chart library, this used to work when it was loaded as a whole
page as the d3 libary would run intending to setup any d3 graphs however
now it is being loaded as a modal the elements that would be affected by
the d3 code do not exist at page load time.

In order to get the date picker events to be added to the elements on
the form when the modal loads, the JS in the forms template has been
extended in this patch to support adding those events.

This patch also changes the data attributes on the form elements so that
they do not conflict with any d3 line chart elements.

Alongside the javascript this patch fixes bug to do with parsing the
dates in metering utils and adds UTs to prevent regression.

Change-Id: I4e239daa03b2f54e434254bac48ba0cceb037b5d
Closes-Bug: 1427756
(cherry picked from commit 0d010f601cecacac01c26be572ae0d6444df9669)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix date pickers in metering modal

The metering forms were using the date picker functionality from the
d3 line chart library, this used to work when it was loaded as a whole
page as the d3 libary would run intending to setup any d3 graphs however
now it is being loaded as a modal the elements that would be affected by
the d3 code do not exist at page load time.

In order to get the date picker events to be added to the elements on
the form when the modal loads, the JS in the forms template has been
extended in this patch to support adding those events.

This patch also changes the data attributes on the form elements so that
they do not conflict with any d3 line chart elements.

Alongside the javascript this patch fixes bug to do with parsing the
dates in metering utils and adds UTs to prevent regression.

Change-Id: I4e239daa03b2f54e434254bac48ba0cceb037b5d
Closes-Bug: 1427756
(cherry picked from commit 0d010f601cecacac01c26be572ae0d6444df9669)

subject: libvirt: Fail when live block migrating instance with volumes

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-04-27 14:42:56.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': 'libvirt: Fail when live block migrating instance with volumes

This raises an exception when attempting to live block migrate (nova
live-migration --block-migrate) an instance with attached volumes.
libvirt copies these volumes from themselves to themselves. At a
minimum, this is horribly slow and de-sparses a sparse volume; at
worst, this could cause massive data corruption.

(cherry picked from commit d667b6a63e80b2f8d6311c2cf224ba32628eed84)

Closes-Bug: 1398999
Change-Id: Ibcd423976bb9fea46e3e1cb23cc8e5cd944d8fc2
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Fail when live block migrating instance with volumes

This raises an exception when attempting to live block migrate (nova
live-migration --block-migrate) an instance with attached volumes.
libvirt copies these volumes from themselves to themselves. At a
minimum, this is horribly slow and de-sparses a sparse volume; at
worst, this could cause massive data corruption.

(cherry picked from commit d667b6a63e80b2f8d6311c2cf224ba32628eed84)

Closes-Bug: 1398999
Change-Id: Ibcd423976bb9fea46e3e1cb23cc8e5cd944d8fc2

commit_message:
Swap a '*.' with a '.*' in the /etc/hosts grep

It looks like this was supposed to be '.*' from the beginning,
though its worth noting that this would work - albeit accidentally -
if the 127.0.0.1 line were followed by precisely one space or one tab
before the inventory hostname.

Change-Id: I0d6596d8d1e6c0ba361429b3980c416fbd0961d6

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-06-04 15:24:41.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/network/test_neutronv2.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/vif.py', 'nova/network/model.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_vif.py'], 'message': "Add new VIF type VIF_TYPE_TAP

This change adds a new VIF type, VIF_TYPE_TAP, whose meaning is that
the host side of a vNIC to/from a VM is - at least initially - a
simple TAP interface that is not plugged into a bridge or vSwitch.  A
Neutron agent running on the compute host may subsequently set up
routing or bridging for that TAP interface.

VIF_TYPE_TAP supports a 'mac_address' key, in the VIF details dict,
which allows Neutron to specify the MAC address for the host end of
the TAP interface.

VIF_TYPE_TAP also respect's nova.conf's network_device_mtu setting,
i.e. it sets this value as the TAP interface's MTU.

Change-Id: Ifd63faaa1ef4e085d9baa640c17da856e0960992
Implements: blueprint vif-type-tap
"}]
commit_message:
Add new VIF type VIF_TYPE_TAP

This change adds a new VIF type, VIF_TYPE_TAP, whose meaning is that
the host side of a vNIC to/from a VM is - at least initially - a
simple TAP interface that is not plugged into a bridge or vSwitch.  A
Neutron agent running on the compute host may subsequently set up
routing or bridging for that TAP interface.

VIF_TYPE_TAP supports a 'mac_address' key, in the VIF details dict,
which allows Neutron to specify the MAC address for the host end of
the TAP interface.

VIF_TYPE_TAP also respect's nova.conf's network_device_mtu setting,
i.e. it sets this value as the TAP interface's MTU.

Change-Id: Ifd63faaa1ef4e085d9baa640c17da856e0960992
Implements: blueprint vif-type-tap

subject: Ensure location header urls account for script_name
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-06-25 09:01:13.000000000', 'files': ['gnocchi/rest/__init__.py', 'test-requirements.txt', 'gnocchi/tests/gabbi/test_gabbi_prefix.py', 'test-requirements-py3.txt'], 'message': 'Ensure location header urls account for script_name

The API is at /v1... but if is mounted at /gnocchi/v1 then
"/gnocchi" is the script_name and we need to account for that when
generatin URLs for location headers.

Pecan already does this where the application_url attribute is being
used (for generating informational urls in response bodies).

A new gabbi test suite is added which runs all of the existing gabbi
tests with a prefix. Getting this to work identified a bug in gabbi,
thus the update to test-requirements.

Change-Id: I6e3b461610ad1b694e6ae3df33831b3f6224668f
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure location header urls account for script_name

The API is at /v1... but if is mounted at /gnocchi/v1 then
"/gnocchi" is the script_name and we need to account for that when
generatin URLs for location headers.

Pecan already does this where the application_url attribute is being
used (for generating informational urls in response bodies).

A new gabbi test suite is added which runs all of the existing gabbi
tests with a prefix. Getting this to work identified a bug in gabbi,
thus the update to test-requirements.

Change-Id: I6e3b461610ad1b694e6ae3df33831b3f6224668f

commit_message:
constraints file support for devstack.

Constraints files allow a global view of dependencies for devstack
without the side effect that requirements files have of installing
everything everytime. This is part of the cross project
requirements-management spec.

Change-Id: If089d30146629e6cf817edd634e5c2b80f1366dd

commit_message:
Redefine CIFS export_location path from '/' to '\'

For Windows users, the export_location is using '\' but manila
export_location using '/'. So redefine the CIFS export_location for
windows user is more affinity.

Change-Id: I11533ddfa3bd7d4f0690091636db6b3e8a67d7dc
Signed-off-by: Ketor <d.ketor@gmail.com>

subject: Disable router advertisements on bridge devices
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-02 15:43:53.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/objects/test_objects.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/vif.py'], 'message': 'Disable router advertisements on bridge devices

In a multi-node Neutron DVR configuration, nova was automatically
configuring the qbr bridge with an IPv6 address. There is no need for
this to occur, as the bridge is only used by the Neutron security group
code.

Change-Id: I4eab9d7b2839d99ec603800f04c1913002de63da
'}]
commit_message:
Disable router advertisements on bridge devices

In a multi-node Neutron DVR configuration, nova was automatically
configuring the qbr bridge with an IPv6 address. There is no need for
this to occur, as the bridge is only used by the Neutron security group
code.

Change-Id: I4eab9d7b2839d99ec603800f04c1913002de63da
