commit_message:
Merge deployments data for collectors heat, request

This is required so that a swift-enabled TripleO undercloud can switch
to polling for metadata from a TempURL rather than heat.

Change-Id: I73ac9e01f85e0c72ce7411e2c61c545322f3dccc
Closes-Bug: #1424913

subject: Enhance run-tox.sh to support functional testing
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-06-23 21:10:28.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/scripts/run-tox.sh'], 'message': 'Enhance run-tox.sh to support functional testing

This change enhances the run-tox.sh script to support invoking tox as
another user and skipping the check for sudo usage, both of which
support rootwrap testing in functional jobs.  This change also adds an
option to move logs to /opt/stack/logs, which is also useful for
functional jobs.

Change-Id: Ia69f0bef031b33265d508e6a47cc8fb294cb4830
'}]
commit_message:
Enhance run-tox.sh to support functional testing

This change enhances the run-tox.sh script to support invoking tox as
another user and skipping the check for sudo usage, both of which
support rootwrap testing in functional jobs.  This change also adds an
option to move logs to /opt/stack/logs, which is also useful for
functional jobs.

Change-Id: Ia69f0bef031b33265d508e6a47cc8fb294cb4830

subject: Headers module missing from enabled list
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-30 15:08:54.000000000', 'files': ['recipes/apache2-server.rb', 'spec/apache2-server_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Headers module missing from enabled list

Our openstack-dashboard sites config is using the Headers directive
to prevent html caching by default for security.  Need to make sure
this module is always enabled under apache.

Change-Id: I6f204f194a80b58e608a0a04afc19442d0444598
Related-Bug: #1446701
'}]
commit_message:
Headers module missing from enabled list

Our openstack-dashboard sites config is using the Headers directive
to prevent html caching by default for security.  Need to make sure
this module is always enabled under apache.

Change-Id: I6f204f194a80b58e608a0a04afc19442d0444598
Related-Bug: #1446701

commit_message:
Refactor merging out of cfn collector

This is a pure refactoring change which moves the os-apply-config
deployment data merging into its own module. This will allow
other collectors (request, heat) to do the same merging.

Partial-Bug: #1424913
Change-Id: Ic78a60e3efebadbb06ebfd262ceb275ca519a3f2

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-24 15:17:08.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/scenario/test_volume_boot_pattern.py'], 'message': 'Get rid of duplicated creation of security groups in test_volume_boot_pattern

It turns out that a security group in test test_volume_boot_pattern
is created twice. The first security group is created in test itself,
the second security group is created in the method _boot_instance_from_
volume(). This patch fixes it. Now the security group is created once.

Change-Id: I99ec28a70591b346e2ea00c6e16af4e856721aa3
'}]
commit_message:
Get rid of duplicated creation of security groups in test_volume_boot_pattern

It turns out that a security group in test test_volume_boot_pattern
is created twice. The first security group is created in test itself,
the second security group is created in the method _boot_instance_from_
volume(). This patch fixes it. Now the security group is created once.

Change-Id: I99ec28a70591b346e2ea00c6e16af4e856721aa3

commit_message:
Updated the clone process to exclude unneeded files

This commit changes the clone process to properly exclude files from the repo
clone play/task. This also ensures that when this play is used that all local
repos are an exact match to what is upstream.

Change-Id: I840997d6778f40a9007bce18df792c6b0c69c5eb
Closes-Bug: #1468567

commit_message:
Make appropriate branch default and updated from global requirements

- Use default value of _BRANCH parameters 'stable/juno' for
  stable/juno release
- Update from global requirements
- Fix lib for using python-muranoclient from stable/juno and openstack
  namespace
- Update .gitreview for using openstack namespace
- Install test-requirements in post_test_hook.sh
- Remove CLI tests
- Update API tests because of tempest updates
- Fix for PEP8 checks after hacking version bump
- Add ignore H233,H405,H904 hacking rules

Change-Id: I7624cba86c7d5612ac32c14e36fb2d020b599e1c
Closes-Bug: #1468746
Closes-Bug: #1469181

libvirt: update VIF metadata with queues in the neutron api

allocating network resources for instance, in neutron API.

commit_message:
libvirt: update NetworkRequest object to support queues

Updating the NetworkRequest object to add the ability to
request queues for each Virtual Interface.

Implements blueprint libvirt-virtio-net-multiqueue

Change-Id: Id8fe3a8dd0905a751ae35dd5b9d6f2f15d15d2e8

commit_message:
Filter snapshots data on the DB side

It filters snapshots data on the DB side to improve performance. 
Some tests are removed from test_snapshots.py because their function
implemented on the DB side.

Partial-Implements: blueprint data-filtering-on-the-db-side
Change-Id: I1c3e47a4f3780de54d7a5920f463e26cc8b7bcc2

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-01 08:22:08.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/compute/volumes/test_volumes_list.py', 'tempest/api/compute/volumes/test_volumes_get.py', 'tempest/services/compute/json/volumes_extensions_client.py', 'tempest/api/compute/volumes/test_volumes_negative.py'], 'message': 'Apply a naming rule of GET to compute clients(v*)

[GET /resources] methods should be "list_<resource name>s"
or "show_<resource name>", so this patch applies the rule
to compute clients which names are "v*".

In addition, this patch removes unnecessary str() because
all callers specify string values and we need to pass py3
tests when migrating them into tempest-lib.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I17b62791b287bb7150603a029049278756a8616d
'}]
commit_message:
Apply a naming rule of GET to compute clients(v*)

[GET /resources] methods should be "list_<resource name>s"
or "show_<resource name>", so this patch applies the rule
to compute clients which names are "v*".

In addition, this patch removes unnecessary str() because
all callers specify string values and we need to pass py3
tests when migrating them into tempest-lib.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I17b62791b287bb7150603a029049278756a8616d

commit_message:
Fix quoting for unix_sock_rw_perms

If the permissions aren't quoted, libvirtd won't start.
(At least, that's the case on my CentOS 7.1 install.)

Change-Id: I3af01420eda0e8461cd71421c3422f8b626b5e1f

commit_message:
Validate LP name before creation

Just some quick sanity checking in the LP controller datamodel.

This review also extends image.base_image_id to 100 characters,
the same size as image.name, as the former can be either a name or
a uuid.

Closes-Bug: #1430469
Closes-Bug: #1451483
Change-Id: Ie27d75d6c167a277fe3cc09fb8dce7e27c2f793c

commit_message:
Apply a naming rule of GET to compute clients(t*)

[GET /resources] methods should be "list_<resource name>s"
or "show_<resource name>", so this patch applies the rule
to compute clients which names are "t*".

In addition, this patch removes unnecessary str() because
all callers specify string values and we need to pass py3
tests when migrating them into tempest-lib.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I9d7787d50f616e74ccbc06388813fc7fcb994dea

commit_message:
Use right oslo.service entry points

Use oslo.service.sslutils and periodic_task entry points to generate
a sample configuration file. oslo.service library doesn't have
an oslo.service entry point.

Change-Id: I240afb39c043fdeb39c7807bdf086927186ab881
Closes-Bug: 1468955

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-07-01 02:54:05.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/common/machine_fixtures.py', 'test-requirements.txt', 'neutron/tests/fullstack/config_fixtures.py', 'neutron/tests/base.py', 'neutron/tests/fullstack/test_l3_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/test_plugin.py', 'neutron/tests/fullstack/fullstack_fixtures.py', 'neutron/tests/retargetable/client_fixtures.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/testlib_api.py', 'neutron/tests/tools.py', 'neutron/tests/common/net_helpers.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/agent/linux/helpers.py'], 'message': "Improve fixture usage.

There were two broad issues with fixtures.

Firstly, the 'SafeFixture' workaround for resource leaks in fixtures
<1.3 is not needed if we depend on fixtures>=1.3.1. While testtools
may raise a TypeError when trying to query a fixture that failed to
setup, this is only ever a cascading failure - it will not cause
tests to fail, cause leaks, or cause tests to incorrectly pass. That
will be fixed in testtools soon to stop it happening (but as it cannot
affect whether a test passes or fails or leaks happen there is no
reason to wait for that). Leaks are seen with fixtures 1.3.0 still
because eventlet raises a BaseException subclass rather than an
Exception subclass, and fixtures 1.3.0 didn't handle that - 1.3.1 does.

Secondly, some of the fixtures had race conditions where things were
started and then cleanups scheduled. Where possible I've fixed those,
but some of them require more significant work to fully address.

Change-Id: I3290712f7274970defda19263f4955e3c78e5ed6
Depends-On: I8c01506894ec0a92b53bc0e4ad14767f2dd6a6b3
Closes-bug: #1453888
"}]
commit_message:
Improve fixture usage.

There were two broad issues with fixtures.

Firstly, the 'SafeFixture' workaround for resource leaks in fixtures
<1.3 is not needed if we depend on fixtures>=1.3.1. While testtools
may raise a TypeError when trying to query a fixture that failed to
setup, this is only ever a cascading failure - it will not cause
tests to fail, cause leaks, or cause tests to incorrectly pass. That
will be fixed in testtools soon to stop it happening (but as it cannot
affect whether a test passes or fails or leaks happen there is no
reason to wait for that). Leaks are seen with fixtures 1.3.0 still
because eventlet raises a BaseException subclass rather than an
Exception subclass, and fixtures 1.3.0 didn't handle that - 1.3.1 does.

Secondly, some of the fixtures had race conditions where things were
started and then cleanups scheduled. Where possible I've fixed those,
but some of them require more significant work to fully address.

Change-Id: I3290712f7274970defda19263f4955e3c78e5ed6
Depends-On: I8c01506894ec0a92b53bc0e4ad14767f2dd6a6b3
Closes-bug: #1453888

commit_message:
Modify RemoteClient to use ssh validation config parameters

This patch implements changes needed to remove the usage of
deprecated tempest ssh configuration parameters and replace it
with the parameters set by ssh auth strategy blueprint

Partially implements: blueprint ssh-auth-strategy

Change-Id: I558a04b0bb61ecf8e428a0f682fbb42a67695318

Add support for bug/ branches for projects that use intermediate
releases to support the case where a change has landed in master and a
bug fix is needed, but the branch to be created should not be seen as a
long term stable release series. For example, if a breaking change is
made in a library in anticipation of a major series version update, but
then a critical bug is found in the previous intermediate release. The

Change-Id: Ic790600c4c058817e32422f7c7d1be7fdbf98994

commit_message:
Treat bug/ and feature/ branches the same way

Add support for bug/ branches for projects that use intermediate
releases to support the case where a change has landed in master and a
bug fix is needed, but the branch to be created should not be seen as a
long term stable release series. For example, if a breaking change is
made in a library in anticipation of a major series version update, but
then a critical bug is found in the previous intermediate release. The
fix could be back-ported and released into the master stream without the
breaking change.

Change-Id: Ic790600c4c058817e32422f7c7d1be7fdbf98994

subject: Default to use host/port for glance_api_servers
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-07-01 10:17:21.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/os_nova/templates/nova.conf.j2', 'playbooks/os-nova-install.yml', 'etc/openstack_deploy/user_group_vars.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_cinder/templates/cinder.conf.j2'], 'message': 'Default to use host/port for glance_api_servers

The glance_api_servers points to a list of glance_api_servers for both
cinder and nova. This causes "nova image-list" to fail when glance api
servers are unavailable. Pointing to the LB VIP works as intended, so
removing this var in favour of the "host/port" vars ensures that only
the glance servers that are available are used.

glance_api_servers is still available and if specified will be used in
favour of host/port, but default it is commented out and the host/port
will be used - which uses the internal_lb_vip_address and default
glance_api_service_port.

Change-Id: I6794a1a266d22944be8d5634ee0c0ce6cd9f2c59
Closes-Bug: #1461245
'}]
commit_message:
Default to use host/port for glance_api_servers

The glance_api_servers points to a list of glance_api_servers for both
cinder and nova. This causes "nova image-list" to fail when glance api
servers are unavailable. Pointing to the LB VIP works as intended, so
removing this var in favour of the "host/port" vars ensures that only
the glance servers that are available are used.

glance_api_servers is still available and if specified will be used in
favour of host/port, but default it is commented out and the host/port
will be used - which uses the internal_lb_vip_address and default
glance_api_service_port.

Change-Id: I6794a1a266d22944be8d5634ee0c0ce6cd9f2c59
Closes-Bug: #1461245

commit_message:
Get rid of dependencies on fixed networks' names

We cannot rely on names of networks anymore as netorking with templates
will allow to create/delete networks and set (almost) arbitrary names
to them. So, we need to tie services for network roles.
While network roles descriptions are in development we can use hardcoded
version where network roles are in plain list and network roles to networks
mapping is fixed.

Change-Id: Ibf523885faa57bb2435f9bf6386258b69063b318
Implements: blueprint templates-for-networking

commit_message:
Updated tempest isolation options

This change updates the way that the packages are installed in an
isolated deployment. This ensures that our build packages are used
within the deployment while also allowing temptest to go online and
consume upstream packages from pypi.

Change-Id: Ia479610b9ab69d64d1de756099d840b2ab331378
Closes-Bug: #1466010
(cherry picked commit from 2086f6edb1a4c50dc0000804a510aa4da1af4f5f)

commit_message:
Separate rpm specs for V2 and V3 added

Add rpm spec for 3.0.0 version that allows includes in rpm
pre-/post-/uninstall hooks. Directory tree modified: separate rpm spec
files must be contained by repo. Version mapping changed to provide new
template path to builders. Tests updated.

DocImpact: Describe spec scripts in Fuel Plugin wiki

Change-Id: I3810a33d13a89ce7145091e85295821fec3e9ba9
Implements: blueprint role-as-a-plugin
Closes-Bug: #1462976

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-07-01 14:49:36.000000000', 'files': ['fuel_agent/fuel_agent/tests/test_build_utils.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/unit/test_stages_task_serialization.py', 'fuel_agent/fuel_agent/utils/build.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/unit/test_tasks_templates.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/orchestrator/tasks_serializer.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/orchestrator/tasks_templates.py'], 'message': "IBP: disable HTTP pipelining for apt

Under certain circumstances HTTP pipelining, which is turned on by default for
apt, could cause slow down of HTTP connection.

As HTTP pipelining is mainly useful for high latency channels such as satellite
Internel connections, there's no apparent speed up for broadband connections.
Moreover, the majority of modern web browsers doesn't enable it by default due
to concerns regarding a large amount of buggy proxies/servers/middleboxes.

So, it could be safely turned off as it brings more harm than good.

Change-Id: Idf1e2f82f2a51080f959e80fe58672c50c4d9772
Closes-Bug: #1470468
"}]
commit_message:
IBP: disable HTTP pipelining for apt

Under certain circumstances HTTP pipelining, which is turned on by default for
apt, could cause slow down of HTTP connection.

As HTTP pipelining is mainly useful for high latency channels such as satellite
Internel connections, there's no apparent speed up for broadband connections.
Moreover, the majority of modern web browsers doesn't enable it by default due
to concerns regarding a large amount of buggy proxies/servers/middleboxes.

So, it could be safely turned off as it brings more harm than good.

Change-Id: Idf1e2f82f2a51080f959e80fe58672c50c4d9772
Closes-Bug: #1470468

Remove puppet-network manifest

Fuel uses masterless puppet. This manifest is not required
anymore.

Implements: blueprint upgrade-openstack-puppet-modules

Change-Id: I68eb73bb41664b8fc14368a5f6def3c1ca49024f

For an offline install, env-setup.sh needs to be able to clone
from locations other than GitHub.  Additionally, since
the ansible repo will have to have its .gitmodules file patched

commit_message:
Allow env-setup.sh to use alternate url/branches

For an offline install, env-setup.sh needs to be able to clone
from locations other than GitHub.  Additionally, since
the ansible repo will have to have its .gitmodules file patched
to point submodules to some other location as well, its convenient
to allow for alternate branches.

As a side-effect, this moves the documentation of what branch
we're using to the top of the script for easy reference and removes
the duplicated branch name.

Change-Id: I7432531915c03638aaf52f836cda607d424351ba

subject: Create Junit XML Report from tempest run
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-01 10:54:01.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/run-tempest.sh', 'playbooks/roles/os_tempest/defaults/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_tempest/templates/openstack_tempest_gate.sh.j2'], 'message': 'Create Junit XML Report from tempest run

Tempest results are currently written to stdout as part of a test run.
This output is difficult to parse. This patch adds steps to generate an
XML report, and make this report available in /tmp on a physical host.

The report is copied to a physical host so that external systems that do
not have knowledge of the container inventory can retrieve the report,
for example Jenkins.

* Add pip packages python-subunit and junitxml to tempest venv, needed
  to convert the subunit stream stored in testrepository to junit XML.

* openstack_tempest_gate:
    After a tempest run completes, the subunit stream is extracted from
    the testrepository, converted to junit XML and written to /tmp in
    the utility container running the tests.

* run-tempest.sh
    After running openstack_tempest_gate, retrieve XML results and write
    them to /tmp on the host.

Change-Id: I897024f545dd2a90f80b0d5c0aa558f335dc963a
Closes-Bug: #1464686
(cherry picked from commit 8a7d5179d66cd43c3f49cec6a764f1073232e6f3)
'}]
commit_message:
Create Junit XML Report from tempest run

Tempest results are currently written to stdout as part of a test run.
This output is difficult to parse. This patch adds steps to generate an
XML report, and make this report available in /tmp on a physical host.

The report is copied to a physical host so that external systems that do
not have knowledge of the container inventory can retrieve the report,
for example Jenkins.

* Add pip packages python-subunit and junitxml to tempest venv, needed
  to convert the subunit stream stored in testrepository to junit XML.

* openstack_tempest_gate:
    After a tempest run completes, the subunit stream is extracted from
    the testrepository, converted to junit XML and written to /tmp in
    the utility container running the tests.

* run-tempest.sh
    After running openstack_tempest_gate, retrieve XML results and write
    them to /tmp on the host.

Change-Id: I897024f545dd2a90f80b0d5c0aa558f335dc963a
Closes-Bug: #1464686
(cherry picked from commit 8a7d5179d66cd43c3f49cec6a764f1073232e6f3)

commit_message:
Configurable memcached connections limit & threads

Increasing memcached_connections may require ulimit to be raised so
that will be done if necessary.

Increasing memcached_threads is not strongly recommended but is
available if needed.

Change-Id: I4b58d59f647e6f843fc33561dea75be67c0f78c4
Closes-Bug: #1438498
(cherry picked from commit d0127d51bdb9a6b51fec5d91f2dbd72177e4c4ca)

commit_message:
Enable public IP in new/custom roles

  Update logic of objects.Node.should_have_public
  Update JSON schema for validation of 'public_ip_required' field
  Add 'public_ip_required' field to 'roles_metadata' of openstack.yaml

commit_message:
Move declaration of TMPDIR to top of build-docker-image

This variable is needed/useful in scripts sourced from
build-docker-image, such as .buildconf

Example use case is when we need to clone git repos or download tarballs
within .buildconf, we want to use the same temp workspace as the build
for this.

Change-Id: If85bd50b91ea62e265aded635ab7e6e5844635fb
Partially-Implements: blueprint install-from-source

commit_message:
Add check against gw port with no IP

Since MidoNet does not handle the case where the gateway port does not
have IPs assigned, prevent such case from happening in the plugin.

Change-Id: I031fc7890c732ffb09305d6f81b7fdf8c16f6430
Fixes: MNP-167

commit_message:
docs: link quality of service doc stub to devref index

Since I433126a8247e7e1c316f2c96bb21e15582b247ce, doc warnings are
considered as failures in gate.

feature/qos. Same for an empty file with no title.

commit_message:
Parallel testing

Now, we can run tests in `test_projects` concurrently.
For this:
 1. activate .venv
 2. pip install multiprocessing
 3. export INTEGRATION_TESTS=1
 4. nosetests --processes=14 --process-timeout=8000 openstack_dashboard.test.integration_tests.tests.test_projects

Change-Id: I298c207518e3a18e58c5a21413e4705901223a2b

commit_message:
IBP: disable ext4 journaling during the image building

In order to speed-up image building process, fuel-agent will
turn off journalling. That should noticeably reduce the cost of
fsync calls. Expected speed-up is about 2x-3x.

Additionaly this change will help image building job to fit within
3600 secs timeout.

Change-Id: I24fcc8ba16c092b1bc936928890717c6e9501aa7
Related-Bug: #1441679

subject: Modify secgroup rule processing
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-30 20:39:47.000000000', 'files': ['shade/tests/unit/test_security_groups.py', 'shade/__init__.py'], 'message': "Modify secgroup rule processing

It turns out that Neutron can accept None for a rule protocol to
represent all protocols. Nova has no similar concept for a single
rule, so let's throw an exception.

Also, Neutron relaxes the rules on accepting None for both port
values to represent the full port range for TCP and UDP. For ICMP,
it is the same as -1.

Change-Id: Icc408586804e2a538399a2aa3f740b97bb4c5246
"}]
commit_message:
Modify secgroup rule processing

It turns out that Neutron can accept None for a rule protocol to
represent all protocols. Nova has no similar concept for a single
rule, so let's throw an exception.

Also, Neutron relaxes the rules on accepting None for both port
values to represent the full port range for TCP and UDP. For ICMP,
it is the same as -1.

Change-Id: Icc408586804e2a538399a2aa3f740b97bb4c5246

subject: Support updating system action definitions in db
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-02 09:21:29.000000000', 'files': ['tools/sync_db.py'], 'message': 'Support updating system action definitions in db

Currently, there is no way to update system action definitions in
database if there are some content changes in mapping.json, the only way
we can do now is to drop the mistral database, and run sync_db.py script
to re-populate system action definitions.

This patch fixes this issue by adding a new argument for sync_db.py, so
that user can update only action difinitions according to mapping.json
as below:

$ python tools/sync_db.py --config-file etc/mistral.conf \
--update-actions-only

Change-Id: I628636ff9847a2ec9c8d45dfa350a1acef55d65b
Closes-Bug: #1470719'}]
commit_message:
Support updating system action definitions in db

Currently, there is no way to update system action definitions in
database if there are some content changes in mapping.json, the only way
we can do now is to drop the mistral database, and run sync_db.py script
to re-populate system action definitions.

This patch fixes this issue by adding a new argument for sync_db.py, so
that user can update only action difinitions according to mapping.json
as below:

$ python tools/sync_db.py --config-file etc/mistral.conf \
--update-actions-only

Change-Id: I628636ff9847a2ec9c8d45dfa350a1acef55d65b
Closes-Bug: #1470719

Ensure we set the event and wait on the timer in the test

This ensures that the looping call is not running after the
test has finished (which is/would be bad).

Enable oslo.vmware dependency on Python 3

suds-jurko is compatible with Python 3.

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 455, 'name': 'Stuart McLaren', 'email': 'stuart.mclaren@hpe.com', 'username': 'stuart-mclaren'}, {'_account_id': 6159, 'name': 'Flavio Percoco Premoli', 'display_name': 'flaper87', 'email': 'flavio.percoco@flyrlabs.com', 'username': 'flaper87'}, {'_account_id': 9107, 'name': 'Victor Stinner', 'email': 'vstinner@redhat.com', 'username': 'haypo'}, {'_account_id': 12000, 'name': 'Ian Cordasco', 'email': 'sigmavirus24@gmail.com', 'username': 'sigmavirus24'}, {'_account_id': 13747, 'name': 'Kuo-tung Kao', 'email': 'jelly.k@inwinstack.com', 'username': 'coding1314'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-06-18 11:30:49.000000000', 'files': ['glance_store/_drivers/swift/store.py', 'glance_store/tests/unit/test_swift_store.py'], 'message': 'Port swift driver to Python 3

* On Python 3, swift_retry_iter() now uses seek()+tell() to get the
  length of a BytesIO object instead of getting the len attribute,
  because the len attribute has been removed in Python 3.
* Replace six.StringIO with six.BytesIO for image content
* Use bytes to handle image content
* Replace int / 2 with int // 2 to use integer division

Change-Id: I0972df318002a6f91c3ef7ddc91330c635ba7e41
'}]
commit_message:
Port swift driver to Python 3

* On Python 3, swift_retry_iter() now uses seek()+tell() to get the
  length of a BytesIO object instead of getting the len attribute,
  because the len attribute has been removed in Python 3.
* Replace six.StringIO with six.BytesIO for image content
* Use bytes to handle image content
* Replace int / 2 with int // 2 to use integer division

Change-Id: I0972df318002a6f91c3ef7ddc91330c635ba7e41

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-06-18 17:57:01.000000000', 'files': ['nova/openstack/common/log.py'], 'message': 'Add support for syslog connect retries

If we have requested logging to syslog and syslog is
not yet ready we shoudl allow for retry attempts. This
patch provides a new option syslog-connect-retries to
allow for retries with a 5 second interval between
each retry.

Closes-Bug: 1459046

Change-Id: I3e5e892ce68a15f783a7d8a1a1fd56f6a53dd0ad
Co-authored-by: Liang Chen <liang.chen@canonical.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for syslog connect retries

If we have requested logging to syslog and syslog is
not yet ready we shoudl allow for retry attempts. This
patch provides a new option syslog-connect-retries to
allow for retries with a 5 second interval between
each retry.

Closes-Bug: 1459046

Change-Id: I3e5e892ce68a15f783a7d8a1a1fd56f6a53dd0ad
Co-authored-by: Liang Chen <liang.chen@canonical.com>

Our explicit call to cleanUp messes things up in latest
fixture, so we need to call _clear_cleanups to stop
the test from breaking

revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2015-06-30 05:27:48.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py', 'neutron/agent/common/ovs_lib.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/common/test_ovs_lib.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/test_ovs_tunnel.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/agent/test_ovs_lib.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/test_ovs_neutron_agent.py'], 'message': 'Read vif port information in bulk

During startup, the agent was making many calls per port
to read information about the current VLAN, external ID, etc.
This resulted in hundreds of calls just to read information about
a relatively small number of ports.

This patch addresses that by converting a few key functions to
lookup information for all of the ports at once.

Performance improvement on dev laptop for 250 ports from agent
start to port ACTIVE status:
   before: 1m21s
   after: 1m06s

Closes-Bug: #1460233
Change-Id: Ic80c85a07fee3e5651dc19819c6cebdc2048dda7
'}]
commit_message:
Read vif port information in bulk

During startup, the agent was making many calls per port
to read information about the current VLAN, external ID, etc.
This resulted in hundreds of calls just to read information about
a relatively small number of ports.

This patch addresses that by converting a few key functions to
lookup information for all of the ports at once.

Performance improvement on dev laptop for 250 ports from agent
start to port ACTIVE status:
   before: 1m21s
   after: 1m06s

Closes-Bug: #1460233
Change-Id: Ic80c85a07fee3e5651dc19819c6cebdc2048dda7

commit_message:
Test UUID duplication fix

This patch adds UUID to all test cases. In this way, tuple
(idempotent _id, case_uuid) is a unique identifier for every tempest test.
Adding case uuid doesn't break compatibility previous workflows based on
idempotent_id.

tools/check_uuid.py contains checks for presence of a case_uuid and its
uniqueness. It is runs during pep8 check. "tox - e uuidgen" can be used
for automatic adding new uuid to new test case.

Closes-Bug: #1433700

Change-Id: Icb568165df4927decc5e0b61803b52e2b60b763e

commit_message:
Improve sequential rabbit master failover

* Add offline node in ceph_check() for case,
when 1 controller with ceph is down.

* Re-initialize os connection before we delete instance

* Make ssh remote in contex manager

Change-Id: I1c08f386d955630da214d6ada91b137a9de8f3aa

Add tests to cover scenario 3-1 rabbit failover:
 * SSH to controller and get rabbit master
 * Suspend not rabbit master node
 * Check that rabbit master stay as was
 * Run ostf
 * Resume slave
 * Check rabbit master is the same
 * Run ostf
 * Suspend rabbit master node
 * Check that new rabbit-master appears
 * Run  ostf
 * Resume node
 * Check that new rabbit-master was not re-elected
 * Run ostf

Change-Id: I6b088f1ea5a6b223826150b1aad705e708343ef9
Closes-Bug: #1435250
'}]
commit_message:
Add test to cover scenario 3-1 rabbit failover

Add tests to cover scenario 3-1 rabbit failover:
 * SSH to controller and get rabbit master
 * Suspend not rabbit master node
 * Check that rabbit master stay as was
 * Run ostf
 * Resume slave
 * Check rabbit master is the same
 * Run ostf
 * Suspend rabbit master node
 * Check that new rabbit-master appears
 * Run  ostf
 * Resume node
 * Check that new rabbit-master was not re-elected
 * Run ostf

Change-Id: I6b088f1ea5a6b223826150b1aad705e708343ef9
Closes-Bug: #1435250

commit_message:
Use /usr/bin/env for script execution

It's a better practice (as it is already widely used in the project)
to use /usr/bin/env to find a binary rather than go with a path.

Change-Id: I7bcc4468603355a3d097bd721ddd64d02dd0a022

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-07-01 11:55:12.000000000', 'files': ['heat_integrationtests/functional/test_validation.py'], 'message': 'Specify network for server in test_validation

This test does not wait, when all resources will be created. However,
it does not mean, that these resources will not be in create in 
progress state. The error, mentioned in the bug, happens, when nova 
tries to create server and see two available networks (private and 
heat-net). Current patch prevents error by adding network
property to Server resource.

Change-Id: I7c1f4931976ae3a899563b1a9da9f8bc7564806c
Closes-Bug: #1467529
'}]
commit_message:
Specify network for server in test_validation

This test does not wait, when all resources will be created. However,
it does not mean, that these resources will not be in create in 
progress state. The error, mentioned in the bug, happens, when nova 
tries to create server and see two available networks (private and 
heat-net). Current patch prevents error by adding network
property to Server resource.

Change-Id: I7c1f4931976ae3a899563b1a9da9f8bc7564806c
Closes-Bug: #1467529

This is to be a new, empty, repository used for release requests as
described in https://review.openstack.org/191193. For now there are no
test jobs, but some will be added later. The publish jobs are defined

commit_message:
Add openstack/releases repository

This is to be a new, empty, repository used for release requests as
described in https://review.openstack.org/191193. For now there are no
test jobs, but some will be added later. The publish jobs are defined
but not used because we expect to eventually publish some static HTML
out of this repository describing our release history.

Change-Id: Ic821b091ffcba7ebb40309a67d241b1f2fbfba02

commit_message:
Update unwrap key to accept specific variables

Unwrap was asking for a json string before, now you
can use explicit variables to pass in data for
unwrapping. Updated tests also to follow suit.

Change-Id: I94f8cef052151fd18073a0f5a858d08a39a3004b

This patch modifies all instances of 'xrange' to 'range'.
Since the range used in source code are not large,

Change-Id: I8f23c2b23ba8a3d8112633186e999759bd2c9193
"}]
commit_message:
Use 'range' instead of 'xrange' for py3 compatibility

The function 'xrange' was renamed to 'range' in Python 3.
This patch modifies all instances of 'xrange' to 'range'.
Since the range used in source code are not large,
it has no side effect in py27.

Change-Id: I8f23c2b23ba8a3d8112633186e999759bd2c9193

subject: Update ChefExample to TomcatChef
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-06-17 14:50:05.000000000', 'files': ['Examples/Chef/TomcatChef/package/LICENSE', 'Examples/Chef/elements/readme.rst', 'Examples/Chef/TomcatChef/package/Classes/Tomcat.yaml', 'Examples/Chef/elements/chef/install.d/60-chef', 'Examples/Chef/TomcatChef/package/manifest.yaml', 'Examples/Chef/TomcatChef/package/Resources/DeployChefTomcat.template', 'Examples/Chef/TomcatChef/package/logo.png', 'Examples/Chef/README.rst', 'Examples/Chef/TomcatChef/package/UI/ui.yaml'], 'message': 'Update ChefExample to TomcatChef

Before murano-apps had a ChefExample app, that could be used as example
of how to use Chef executor. Unfortunatelly this app was only
half-developed and lacked UI definition, therefore could not be used as
it was.
This commit adds UI definition, updates all strings/names from
ChefExample to Tomcat (since the app deploys tomcat), adds logo,
improves reporting messages and adds apt cookcbook, to allow deployment
on apt repositories.

Change-Id: I2c5f2604d5ffdc24550a76c3f9511a0202e3f2be
Partial-Bug: #1465294
'}]
commit_message:
Update ChefExample to TomcatChef

Before murano-apps had a ChefExample app, that could be used as example
of how to use Chef executor. Unfortunatelly this app was only
half-developed and lacked UI definition, therefore could not be used as
it was.
This commit adds UI definition, updates all strings/names from
ChefExample to Tomcat (since the app deploys tomcat), adds logo,
improves reporting messages and adds apt cookcbook, to allow deployment
on apt repositories.

Change-Id: I2c5f2604d5ffdc24550a76c3f9511a0202e3f2be
Partial-Bug: #1465294

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-26 20:09:18.000000000', 'files': ['etc/barbican/policy.json', 'barbican/tests/api/test_resources_policy.py'], 'message': "Fix for admin and creator user access for secret/container read calls

User with 'admin' role in secret/container project should have access even
when project-access is marked False (private). So modified policy rule and
adjusted unit test as earlier tested were generating error for 'admin' user.

Also fixed access issue related to user who initially created the secret or
container. In project access False case, that user can access secret or container
as long as that user token has 'creator' role in secret/container project.

Change-Id: I8ec1c29e0200c8af1706fdd474f4d96a10cf6449
Closes-bug: #1468904
"}]
commit_message:
Fix for admin and creator user access for secret/container read calls

User with 'admin' role in secret/container project should have access even
when project-access is marked False (private). So modified policy rule and
adjusted unit test as earlier tested were generating error for 'admin' user.

Also fixed access issue related to user who initially created the secret or
container. In project access False case, that user can access secret or container
as long as that user token has 'creator' role in secret/container project.

Change-Id: I8ec1c29e0200c8af1706fdd474f4d96a10cf6449
Closes-bug: #1468904

commit_message:
Add logging of agent heartbeats

When troubleshooting problems with cluster it would be
very convenient to have information about agent heartbeats
logged with some searchable identifier which could create
1-to-1 mapping between events in agent's logs and server's logs.

Currently agent's heartbeats are not logged at all on server side.
Since on a large cluster that could create too much logging
(even for troubleshooting cases), it might make sense to make
this configurable both on neutron-server side and on agent-side.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I0a127ef274a84bba5de47395d47b62f48bd4be16
Closes-Bug: #1452582

commit_message:
[network-guide] Update legacy scenarios

Update legacy scenarios as follows:

1) Rename scenario files and adjust titles accordingly.
2) Add traffic flow case for instances on same network.
3) Clarify existing traffic flow cases.
4) Add kernel configuration to network and compute nodes.
5) Remove extraneous configuration options from network and
   compute nodes.
6) Add validation steps for floating IP address.
7) Replace tenant with project.

Partial-Bug: #1465778
Partial-Bug: #1465783

Change-Id: I16099eaf8c5613c382d77db571d25a03f4155cb0

subject: Remove (test-)requirements-py3.txt files
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-07-01 18:27:46.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'requirements-py3.txt', 'test-requirements-py3.txt'], 'message': "Remove (test-)requirements-py3.txt files

The requirements gate is failing because there was
a recent change to project-config
I1d254c42e0bc2550ceeb768532448b5797d87caf
which makes sure there are no duplicate entries in requirements
files. Since we have multiple separate requirements
files for 2.7 and 3.4, the newly added condition fails
the requirements job. Let's use environment markers
to fix this like I318750ec9fe471d3df57ad2f5785026dae451242
and have a unified (test-)requirements file.

Change-Id: Iea1adcd5bae7cdbec194197004eb7e2937cafcf9
"}]
commit_message:
Remove (test-)requirements-py3.txt files

The requirements gate is failing because there was
a recent change to project-config
I1d254c42e0bc2550ceeb768532448b5797d87caf
which makes sure there are no duplicate entries in requirements
files. Since we have multiple separate requirements
files for 2.7 and 3.4, the newly added condition fails
the requirements job. Let's use environment markers
to fix this like I318750ec9fe471d3df57ad2f5785026dae451242
and have a unified (test-)requirements file.

Change-Id: Iea1adcd5bae7cdbec194197004eb7e2937cafcf9

commit_message:
Prepare SignalResponder class for more signal types

This change makes some minor refactorings in the SignalResponder class
to disambiguate the existing signal support and allow for the addition
of other signal types currently supported elsewhere in the codebase.

Implements: partial blueprint uniform-resource-signals
Change-Id: I353558431a8851e4e43c8a787f03190ed508bb5d

commit_message:
Resource plugin for cinder volume encryption

This commit provides a resource plugin to support encryption
volume type.
All volumes that will be created with encryption volume type
will be encrypted.

Implements: blueprint cinder-volume-encryption

commit_message:
Adding identity ng-users panel

This sets up the python side of the users panel.
We need to do this since a panel still needs to inherit from base.html
and navigation is still tightly coupled with Dashboard.

This provides a cleaner way to phase out the old users panel.
This ensures that integration tests does not break until we are ready to
replace the old panel.

To test set DISABLED to False in _250_identity_users_panel.py

Change-Id: Ied6db285ccac0d70a7be4cb1e795b1a2c9058c19

subject: Kill hung frame listeners on each verify networks event
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-01 10:39:21.000000000', 'files': ['mcagents/net_probe.rb'], 'message': 'Kill hung frame listeners on each verify networks event

Network checker relies on interrupt signal for its own
internal logic, so after interrupt is received - it will
do some parsing work and wont finish immediatly.

But before starting frame listeners in a new run - old frame
listeners may be not interrupted because mcollective failed
due timeout or any other not predicted problem.
So, we need to completely shutdown frame listeners with kill -9

Tested:
  Spawned bunch of - /usr/bin/python /usr/bin/net_probe.py -c listen.conf
  Executed network verification from UI - all old listeners were killed,
  verification succeeded.
  Also, executed same test with removed pid files in /var/run/net_probe folder

Change-Id: I7aa48d00b3f86827ba9860a3e3797ed5bd0eb713
Closes-Bug: 1466020
'}]
commit_message:
Kill hung frame listeners on each verify networks event

Network checker relies on interrupt signal for its own
internal logic, so after interrupt is received - it will
do some parsing work and wont finish immediatly.

But before starting frame listeners in a new run - old frame
listeners may be not interrupted because mcollective failed
due timeout or any other not predicted problem.
So, we need to completely shutdown frame listeners with kill -9

Tested:
  Spawned bunch of - /usr/bin/python /usr/bin/net_probe.py -c listen.conf
  Executed network verification from UI - all old listeners were killed,
  verification succeeded.
  Also, executed same test with removed pid files in /var/run/net_probe folder

Change-Id: I7aa48d00b3f86827ba9860a3e3797ed5bd0eb713
Closes-Bug: 1466020

commit_message:
Kill hung frame listeners on each verify networks event

Network checker relies on interrupt signal for its own
internal logic, so after interrupt is received - it will
do some parsing work and wont finish immediatly.

But before starting frame listeners in a new run - old frame
listeners may be not interrupted because mcollective failed
due timeout or any other not predicted problem.
So, we need to completely shutdown frame listeners with kill -9

Tested:
  Spawned bunch of - /usr/bin/python /usr/bin/net_probe.py -c listen.conf
  Executed network verification from UI - all old listeners were killed,
  verification succeeded.
  Also, executed same test with removed pid files in /var/run/net_probe folder

Change-Id: I7aa48d00b3f86827ba9860a3e3797ed5bd0eb713
Closes-Bug: 1466020

commit_message:
keystone/auth: make service description configurable

This commit adds the service description and service description ec2
(service_description{,_ec2}) as a class parameter in order to allow
users to update from a previous version if the service description
is changed (incorrectly spelled or wrong description)

Change-Id: I220e3adf4e96d82d3de6cfe065a80e30a36de5f7
Closes-Bug: #1468407

commit_message:
Move SessionClient from HTTPClient to adapter

Many projects use keystoneclient adapter for SessionClient
realisation, but heatclient use HTTPClient, which is break
SessionClient logic (e.g. using credentials and endpoint).

Change-Id: I90bc9d9fcd1058c3eca288f08dd134810f1b0000
Closes-bug: #1427596

commit_message:
Remove keystoneclient CLI references in README

The content of this file determines what it shown in pypi, which
many end users see. Highlighting our soon to be deprecated CLI
as a feature for python-keystoneclient seems illogical.

Update requirements by hand.

recently) into the requirements files they should now use.

see what happens on test.

Villalovos', 'email': 'openstack.org@sodarock.com', 'username': 'jlvillal'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 13, 'created': '2015-06-30 15:42:24.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/conductor/test_manager.py', 'ironic/conductor/manager.py'], 'message': "Clean nodes stuck in DEPLOYING state when ir-cond restarts

When a conductor managing a node dies abruptly mid deployment (due some
OMM killer, power outage, etc...) the node will get stuck in the
DEPLOYING state. There is no timeout for nodes in DEPLOYING state, and
if a conductor with the same hostname comes back online, it merely
releases the locks held by that hostname. This is not enough, however,
because the API service prevents changes to nodes in DEPLOYING state. We
need the conductor to update the node's provision state from DEPLOYING
to DEPLOYFAIL. The only work around is directly modifying the DB today.

This patch mitigates this problem by adding a step during conductor
startup: after releasing locks previously held by this conductor, it
will now query the database to identify nodes in the DEPLOYING state
that no longer have a valid lock. These nodes are then transitioned to
the DEPLOYFAIL state.

Nodes locked by other conductors, or in the DEPLOYING state with a valid
lock, will remain untouched.

Partial-Bug: #1461937
Change-Id: I59638661e35b80ef6c07a204889a45882acf5684
"}]
commit_message:
Clean nodes stuck in DEPLOYING state when ir-cond restarts

When a conductor managing a node dies abruptly mid deployment (due some
OMM killer, power outage, etc...) the node will get stuck in the
DEPLOYING state. There is no timeout for nodes in DEPLOYING state, and
if a conductor with the same hostname comes back online, it merely
releases the locks held by that hostname. This is not enough, however,
because the API service prevents changes to nodes in DEPLOYING state. We
need the conductor to update the node's provision state from DEPLOYING
to DEPLOYFAIL. The only work around is directly modifying the DB today.

This patch mitigates this problem by adding a step during conductor
startup: after releasing locks previously held by this conductor, it
will now query the database to identify nodes in the DEPLOYING state
that no longer have a valid lock. These nodes are then transitioned to
the DEPLOYFAIL state.

Nodes locked by other conductors, or in the DEPLOYING state with a valid
lock, will remain untouched.

Partial-Bug: #1461937
Change-Id: I59638661e35b80ef6c07a204889a45882acf5684

commit_message:
Getting libvirt functional for testing on RedHat/CentOS

Due to differing default groups across distributions, we need
to variablize the group to add ironic to have access to the
virtualization subsystem.

Additionally on RedHat/CentOS, libvirt is compiled with polkit which
is incompatible with agent_ssh based testing.

Change-Id: Ia175331cefb758ba5ef122c1b573f6235720f0dc
Partial-Bug: 1463871

commit_message:
Ensure run_watchers called from mixin, not base class

A new mixin was introduced to share run_watchers across drivers,
but the base class's run_watchers() currently gets called instead,
resulting in a NotImplemented error.

Change-Id: I5f23f63100a9c00837025b291cb1db0a5187a8e9
Closes-bug: #1470264

commit_message:
puppet: disable voting for beaker/centos7 jobs

We're having serious troubles to install RDO packaging on Centos7 with
Beaker jobs.

We need more time to figure that out and fix it, in the mean time, we
need to disable voting for this job.

Change-Id: I06114f34593e8964189e9818a9d1c736e961d66f
Partial-bug: #1470685

subject: Fix addition of plugin panel to panel group
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-06-18 16:12:18.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/test/test_panels/second_panel/views.py', 'openstack_dashboard/test/test_panels/second_panel/urls.py', 'openstack_dashboard/test/test_plugins/panel_group_tests.py', 'openstack_dashboard/test/test_plugins/panel_tests.py', 'horizon/base.py', 'openstack_dashboard/test/test_plugins/panel_group_config/_40_admin_add_panel_to_second_group.py', 'openstack_dashboard/test/helpers.py', 'openstack_dashboard/test/test_panels/plugin_panel/views.py', 'openstack_dashboard/test/test_panels/second_panel/panel.py', 'openstack_dashboard/test/test_panels/second_panel/templates/second_panel/index.html', 'openstack_dashboard/test/test_panels/second_panel/__init__.py', 'openstack_dashboard/test/test_plugins/panel_group_config/_30_admin_add_second_panel_group.py'], 'message': 'Fix addition of plugin panel to panel group

Revert fix from bug #1329050, which adds a plugin panel to its dashboard's
class. Adding a plugin panel to a dashboard whose class has its panels defined
in a tuple will fail because the new plugin cannot be appended to the tuple.
The code errors out before the panel gets added to the dashboard's panel list.
However, at this point, the panel has already been registered with the
dashboard. This causes Dashboard.get_panels() to see the panel in its registry
but not in its panel groups. Consequently, the panel gets put in the "Other"
panel group instead of its configured one, as described in bug #1378558.

By not adding the the plugin panel to its dashboard's class, the panel gets
added to its dashboard's panel list. Now the original issue from bug #1329050
resurfaces. The root cause of that is that every time Dashboard._autodiscover()
is called, it instantiates all its panel group classes, wiping out any panels
previously added to any of the panel groups. Avoid this by always processing
all the plugin panel groups before any of the plugin panels, which also ensures
that the panel groups exist before their panels.

Making this change exposed an issue where the Horizon URLs were being loaded
twice during the plugin infrastructure's unit tests, causing plugin panels to
be added multiple times to their dashboards. Fix that by removing the second,
unnecessary call. Also create a second test plugin panel group and panel to
test the scenarios described in the two bugs addressed here, adding two panel
groups at a time.

Change-Id: Id6a99c3ff18102c8f47431638d4dda98f14ec641
Closes-Bug: 1378558
(cherry picked from commit e2ef492311a427fe3b5b41a6df6bd9be5a22c174)
(cherry picked from commit 5c1604275bfbe621e5e168f8ba1f937d308d6ab8)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix addition of plugin panel to panel group

Revert fix from bug #1329050, which adds a plugin panel to its dashboard's
class. Adding a plugin panel to a dashboard whose class has its panels defined
in a tuple will fail because the new plugin cannot be appended to the tuple.
The code errors out before the panel gets added to the dashboard's panel list.
However, at this point, the panel has already been registered with the
dashboard. This causes Dashboard.get_panels() to see the panel in its registry
but not in its panel groups. Consequently, the panel gets put in the "Other"
panel group instead of its configured one, as described in bug #1378558.

By not adding the the plugin panel to its dashboard's class, the panel gets
added to its dashboard's panel list. Now the original issue from bug #1329050
resurfaces. The root cause of that is that every time Dashboard._autodiscover()
is called, it instantiates all its panel group classes, wiping out any panels
previously added to any of the panel groups. Avoid this by always processing
all the plugin panel groups before any of the plugin panels, which also ensures
that the panel groups exist before their panels.

Making this change exposed an issue where the Horizon URLs were being loaded
twice during the plugin infrastructure's unit tests, causing plugin panels to
be added multiple times to their dashboards. Fix that by removing the second,
unnecessary call. Also create a second test plugin panel group and panel to
test the scenarios described in the two bugs addressed here, adding two panel
groups at a time.

Change-Id: Id6a99c3ff18102c8f47431638d4dda98f14ec641
Closes-Bug: 1378558
(cherry picked from commit e2ef492311a427fe3b5b41a6df6bd9be5a22c174)
(cherry picked from commit 5c1604275bfbe621e5e168f8ba1f937d308d6ab8)

commit_message:
Increase ping count on ARP spoof test

The other IPv4 tests all have a count of 2 to tolerate
ping failures due to slow ARP response/interface setup/etc.
This patch increases test_arp_spoof_allowed_address_pairs_0cidr
to 2 to match.

Closes-Bug: #1470234
Change-Id: I82bd8397672194f6162eef5392d4f19d57450552

commit_message:
Refactor rally/deploy -> rally/deployment

We should rename this directory to be consistent in naming
and "deploy" is verb which causes misunderstanding...

There are already few places where deployment is used:

1) "rally deployment" command and
2) https://github.com/openstack/rally/blob/master/rally/cli/commands/deployment.py
3) https://github.com/openstack/rally/blob/master/rally/objects/deploy.py#L22
4) https://github.com/openstack/rally/blob/master/rally/db/sqlalchemy/models.py#L55

and we should continue this work and use always "deployment"

Change-Id: I0cdf01a80658288f55258587a7704ce0eb47d532

subject: Have build all script build docker images in parallel
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-04-03 02:18:39.000000000', 'files': ['tools/build-all-docker-images'], 'message': "Have build all script build docker images in parallel

This improves the build speed when building all images.

The script now checks every 5 seconds (totally arbitrary) for images
that it can start building and launch the build process for each image
in parallel.

At the moment there is no limit on the number of parallel builds, I'm
waiting for feedback to see if it is necessary to make it configurable.

The script was also changed to log build output to
/tmp/kolla_build_${img_name}.log where $img_name is the docker image
name in order to prevent logs mixing up. Log files are overwritten
between builds.

Change-Id: Ie0556d2f718545c35266626120c680325ba63a29
"}]
commit_message:
Have build all script build docker images in parallel

This improves the build speed when building all images.

The script now checks every 5 seconds (totally arbitrary) for images
that it can start building and launch the build process for each image
in parallel.

At the moment there is no limit on the number of parallel builds, I'm
waiting for feedback to see if it is necessary to make it configurable.

The script was also changed to log build output to
/tmp/kolla_build_${img_name}.log where $img_name is the docker image
name in order to prevent logs mixing up. Log files are overwritten
between builds.

Change-Id: Ie0556d2f718545c35266626120c680325ba63a29

'elements/kolla/elements/source-repositories/package-installs.yaml', 'elements/kolla/elements/yum/post-install.d'], 'message': 'WIP Build docker images from diskimage elements

This commits adds a `docker-image-create` script that creates a docker
image from a set of diskimage elements. It takes a base image and
a target element as parameters:

    docker-image-create fedora:20 rabbitmq-server

This commit adds a few git submodules, so in order to get the script to
run you need to pull the submodules:

    git submodule update --init --recursive

The goal of `docker-image-create` is to have an equivalent of
`disk-image-create` that produce docker images. It will mimic its
behavior with a few differences:

* Each element results in a new layer added to the docker image.

* All files in `bin` will be copied to /usr/local/bin.

* Environment variables exported in `environment.d` will be added to
`/etc/profile.d/dib-environment.sh` after being evaluated.

* It keeps the list of installed elements in `/etc/dib-elements`.

Some elements had to be modified in order to work in a container
environment. Their implementation in `elements/kolla` takes precedence
over their original one in `elements/diskimage-builder` or
`elements/tripleo-image-elements`.

'}]
commit_message:
WIP Build docker images from diskimage elements

This commits adds a `docker-image-create` script that creates a docker
image from a set of diskimage elements. It takes a base image and
a target element as parameters:

    docker-image-create fedora:20 rabbitmq-server

This commit adds a few git submodules, so in order to get the script to
run you need to pull the submodules:

    git submodule update --init --recursive

The goal of `docker-image-create` is to have an equivalent of
`disk-image-create` that produce docker images. It will mimic its
behavior with a few differences:

* Each element results in a new layer added to the docker image.

* All files in `bin` will be copied to /usr/local/bin.

* Environment variables exported in `environment.d` will be added to
`/etc/profile.d/dib-environment.sh` after being evaluated.

* It keeps the list of installed elements in `/etc/dib-elements`.

Some elements had to be modified in order to work in a container
environment. Their implementation in `elements/kolla` takes precedence
over their original one in `elements/diskimage-builder` or
`elements/tripleo-image-elements`.

Change-Id: I4eef56cd8f70566dcb100024bfd77e413ca841fe

commit_message:
Add new oslo libraries

Full list for liberty is as follows:
* oslo.service
* oslo.reports
* automaton
* futurist

oslo.cache was already added in the earlier review

Some of the entries are already there, though automaton was
missing in one spot. Made sure all references have all five
libraries.

Change-Id: Iffb720d46058424924469695a3ae1e4f20655f99

commit_message:
Apply auto-file-discovery to plugins

When AUTO_DISCOVER_STATIC_FILES enabled in a plugin dashboard,
static files including JavaScript files and static angular html
templates will be automatically discovered.

Change-Id: I7a88983f2604b71431b5b18c97a5c22c37961141
Partially-Implements: blueprint auto-js-file-finding

commit_message:
Use random strings to create heat stack name

Senlin can use duplicated node names, but heat stack's names
are not allowed to be the same. Add some random strings to
create new heat stack names.

Change-Id: Idb0c7cdbe39a3d70f031d466258f9894bcde7607
Closes-Bug:#1469957

commit_message:
Redirect URL for invalid data source details page

Using an invalid data source ID for details URL should
not redirect user from current data sources table to
an empty details page. This patch adds a redirect URL
and logging for this case.

Change-Id: I4ea36583456be0d637fe173fd2f8fae8a050f31e
Closes-Bug: #1466453

commit_message:

Using an invalid job binary ID for details URL causes
a stack trace. This patch adds a proper error message and
logging for this case.

Partial-Bug: #1466453

[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-06-22 20:49:27.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/test_dellscapi.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/dell/dell_storagecenter_common.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/dell/dell_storagecenter_api.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_dellsc.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/dell/dell_storagecenter_fc.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/dell/dell_storagecenter_iscsi.py'], 'message': 'Dell SC: Enable use of Storage Profiles

The Storage Center array allows volumes to be associated with
different Storage Profiles. These profiles allow setting tiering
and RAID types per volume. The driver currently only uses the
default Storage Profile configured for the Cinder user account.

This patch adds the capability to use different Storage Profiles
by using extra specs to allow the creation of different volume
types for the desired profiles.

DocImpact

Change-Id: Icf76fceca5a0ae20bb08b276b0c41ef6cdb31087
'}]
commit_message:
Dell SC: Enable use of Storage Profiles

The Storage Center array allows volumes to be associated with
different Storage Profiles. These profiles allow setting tiering
and RAID types per volume. The driver currently only uses the
default Storage Profile configured for the Cinder user account.

This patch adds the capability to use different Storage Profiles
by using extra specs to allow the creation of different volume
types for the desired profiles.

DocImpact

Change-Id: Icf76fceca5a0ae20bb08b276b0c41ef6cdb31087

commit_message:
Rename rally/benchmark to rally/task

We need to reduce amount of works in our glossary
Rally task commands are based on what is in rally/benchmark
So it will be better to call this directory properly

Change-Id: I7dccdec82c24942517cb2611a8e12218db6118f1

commit_message:
tests: move a test to the proper class in test_resource_tracker

The test test_set_instance_host_and_node very little to do with resizing
an instance in the resource tracker so we move it out of the
ResizeClaimTestCase.

Also test_set_instance_host_and_node does nothing with instance claims,
so it too should live in a more general test suite. Move it too.

Change-Id: Iae7664df6b92b502f2c50799b1101fe7d69dc7b2

subject: Run functional tests using keystone auth options
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-06-04 12:55:36.000000000', 'files': ['tests/sample.conf', 'tests/functional/test_swiftclient.py'], 'message': 'Run functional tests using keystone auth options

Makes the existing functional tests run using three
auth modes: tempauth (v1), keystone v2 and keystone v3.
The latter uses an account in a non-default domain
(which exists in devstack setup).

This should help avoid regressions in handling different
auth options.

Change-Id: Ifee6a4fa418242892bf73eda5e2cad7b803b1bee
'}]
commit_message:
Run functional tests using keystone auth options

Makes the existing functional tests run using three
auth modes: tempauth (v1), keystone v2 and keystone v3.
The latter uses an account in a non-default domain
(which exists in devstack setup).

This should help avoid regressions in handling different
auth options.

Change-Id: Ifee6a4fa418242892bf73eda5e2cad7b803b1bee

subject: Add passenv to tox.ini to make functests run with tempauth
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-03 16:52:24.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Add passenv to tox.ini to make functests run with tempauth

Since tox version 2.0.0 env vars are not passed to the test
env, which means that the SWIFT_TEST_CONFIG_FILE var is not
passed in to tox -e func env. That means that both times
tox -e func runs it is using keystone auth, and never using
tempauth.

Related-Bug: 1455102

Co-Authored-By: Christian Schwede <cschwede@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I23dcdbcde0bf8adc9429eb2d294a2c778005d136
'}]
commit_message:
Add passenv to tox.ini to make functests run with tempauth

Since tox version 2.0.0 env vars are not passed to the test
env, which means that the SWIFT_TEST_CONFIG_FILE var is not
passed in to tox -e func env. That means that both times
tox -e func runs it is using keystone auth, and never using
tempauth.

Related-Bug: 1455102

Co-Authored-By: Christian Schwede <cschwede@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I23dcdbcde0bf8adc9429eb2d294a2c778005d136

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-30 16:06:19.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/linuxbridge/agent/linuxbridge_neutron_agent.py'], 'message': 'Remove bridge cleanup call

Remove the bridge cleanup call to delete bridges, since we are seeing
race conditions where bridges are deleted, then new interfaces are
created and are attempting to plug into the bridge before it is
recreated.

Change-Id: I4ccc96566a5770384eacbbdc492bf09a514f5b31
Related-Bug: #1328546
'}]
commit_message:
Remove bridge cleanup call

Remove the bridge cleanup call to delete bridges, since we are seeing
race conditions where bridges are deleted, then new interfaces are
created and are attempting to plug into the bridge before it is
recreated.

Change-Id: I4ccc96566a5770384eacbbdc492bf09a514f5b31
Related-Bug: #1328546

subject: Increase httplib._MAXHEADERS
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-01 12:40:40.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/proxy/test_server.py', 'test/functional/__init__.py', 'etc/swift.conf-sample', 'swift/common/constraints.py', 'test/functional/swift_test_client.py', 'swift/common/bufferedhttp.py'], 'message': 'Increase httplib._MAXHEADERS

Python 2.7.9+ and 3.2.6+ limits the number of maximum headers in httplib to 100
[1,2,3]. This setting is too low for Swift.

By default the maximum number of allowed headers depends on the number of max
allowed metadata settings plus a default value of 32 for regular http headers.
If for some reason this is not enough (custom middleware for example) it can be

commit_message:
Increase httplib._MAXHEADERS

Python 2.7.9+ and 3.2.6+ limits the number of maximum headers in httplib to 100
[1,2,3]. This setting is too low for Swift.

By default the maximum number of allowed headers depends on the number of max
allowed metadata settings plus a default value of 32 for regular http headers.
If for some reason this is not enough (custom middleware for example) it can be
increased with the extra_header_count constraint.

[1] https://bugs.python.org/issue16037
[2] https://hg.python.org/cpython/raw-file/15c95b7d81dc/Misc/NEWS
[3] https://hg.python.org/cpython/raw-file/v3.2.6/Misc/NEWS

commit_message:
Wait until the image is registered in Sahara image test

The tests consistently fails, probably because the availability
of the image in the table is checked too soon. Add a bit of delay
with a new wait method.

Closes-Bug: #1466744

commit_message:
Add connection release test

This patch adds a small test to ensure a connection
is released after all chunks have been consumed.

It's a follow up to commit 8756591b and added to ensure
there will be no regression in the future (this test
fails also with that patch not applied).

Change-Id: I6a6fcd26879eb2070f418c8770a395ff6c30aa51

subject: Remove all DLO segments on upload of replacement
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-23 19:15:36.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/test_shell.py', 'swiftclient/service.py'], 'message': "Remove all DLO segments on upload of replacement

Previously, only the first container-listing's worth of segments was
deleted, which would leave behind orphaned segments when the object was
very large with small segments or the server's container_listing_limit
was small.

In addition, process DLO and SLO deletions on the segment thread pool,
rather than the object thread pool.

Change-Id: I1587375261a6237fa55a9cb96bda8dae918cc795
Related-Bug: #1418007
"}]
commit_message:
Remove all DLO segments on upload of replacement

Previously, only the first container-listing's worth of segments was
deleted, which would leave behind orphaned segments when the object was
very large with small segments or the server's container_listing_limit
was small.

In addition, process DLO and SLO deletions on the segment thread pool,
rather than the object thread pool.

Change-Id: I1587375261a6237fa55a9cb96bda8dae918cc795
Related-Bug: #1418007

subject: Consolidate the fernet provider issue_v3_token()
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2015-07-01 18:58:33.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/token/providers/pkiz.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/token/test_pki_provider.py', 'keystone/token/providers/common.py', 'keystone/token/providers/pki.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_auth.py', 'keystone/token/providers/uuid.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/token/test_pkiz_provider.py', 'keystone/token/providers/fernet/core.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/token/test_fernet_provider.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/token/test_uuid_provider.py'], 'message': 'Consolidate the fernet provider issue_v3_token()

When the Fernet token provider was implemented, it extended the
provider.common.py:BaseProvider class. It also overrode most all common methods
the BaseProvider implemented. Other token providers in Keystone (like the UUID
an PKI providers) just implemente a _get_token_id method because token ids may
be different across providers.

This commit removes the issue_v3_token() method from the fernet.Provider. This
ensure that the Fernet provider uses the same issue_v3_token() that all the
other token providers use.

Subsequent patches will do the same for issue_v2_token, validate_v3_token, and
validate_v2_token.

Change-Id: I03f56c9c84389a6d6cdb3a6863fcbfca486af337
'}]
commit_message:
Consolidate the fernet provider issue_v3_token()

When the Fernet token provider was implemented, it extended the
provider.common.py:BaseProvider class. It also overrode most all common methods
the BaseProvider implemented. Other token providers in Keystone (like the UUID
an PKI providers) just implemente a _get_token_id method because token ids may
be different across providers.

This commit removes the issue_v3_token() method from the fernet.Provider. This
ensure that the Fernet provider uses the same issue_v3_token() that all the
other token providers use.

Subsequent patches will do the same for issue_v2_token, validate_v3_token, and
validate_v2_token.

Change-Id: I03f56c9c84389a6d6cdb3a6863fcbfca486af337

subject: Tidy up 'Instance Boot Source' selection process.
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-07-01 18:53:24.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/instances/workflows/create_instance.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/instances/tests.py'], 'message': "Tidy up 'Instance Boot Source' selection process.

- If there are no instance snapshots available, don't include this as an option.

- If there are no images available, don't include this as an option.

- If there is only one option available for Instance Boot Source, just select it
  automatically and forego the '--- select source---' prompt.

- If there are no options available for Instance Boot Source, say so.

Change-Id: I7c8ac82b801f7ce92068984290f2c689a7895995
"}]
commit_message:
Tidy up 'Instance Boot Source' selection process.

- If there are no instance snapshots available, don't include this as an option.

- If there are no images available, don't include this as an option.

- If there is only one option available for Instance Boot Source, just select it
  automatically and forego the '--- select source---' prompt.

- If there are no options available for Instance Boot Source, say so.

Change-Id: I7c8ac82b801f7ce92068984290f2c689a7895995

commit_message:
Don't check flavors disk size when booting from a volume

When booting from a volume we don't need to bother checking
if the size of the volume is greater than the size of the flavor.

Change-Id: I04062b64fb72869d3223798cf1911df189764299
Closes-Bug: #1466305

commit_message:
update os-brick to pass python3 tests

This patch adds the py34 tests for tox.ini and updates some
unit tests, exception and some code to support passing the
py34 tests.

commit_message:
go: replicator only read files once

This modifies the replicator to only read files once when replicating to
multiple recipients.  It also replicates to all recipients concurrently.

The implementation might be streamlined later.

Change-Id: Ibee8ed574626d6b943b71e5335b5fbbcabf9220e

subject: Bump hacking in test-requirements
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-07-01 18:23:47.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Bump hacking in test-requirements

The gate-swiftclient-dsvm-functional job takes updates from
openstack/requirements and tries to run functional tests against them.
However, the global requirements recently added environment markers
(like "futures>=3.0;python_version=='2.7' or python_version=='2.6'")
which require pbr>=1.2. pbr was getting capped at 1.0 by hacking<0.9, so
bump it to get newer pbr.

Change-Id: I10af36602d23db78c2863d84c0012835b310bbdd
'}]
commit_message:
Bump hacking in test-requirements

The gate-swiftclient-dsvm-functional job takes updates from
openstack/requirements and tries to run functional tests against them.
However, the global requirements recently added environment markers
(like "futures>=3.0;python_version=='2.7' or python_version=='2.6'")
which require pbr>=1.2. pbr was getting capped at 1.0 by hacking<0.9, so
bump it to get newer pbr.

Change-Id: I10af36602d23db78c2863d84c0012835b310bbdd

subject: Add Beryllium and Lithium Stable support
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-07-01 17:59:03.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/pre_test_hook.sh', 'devstack/odl-releases/beryllium-snapshot-0.4.0', 'devstack/odl-releases/helium-0.2.3-SR3', 'devstack/odl-releases/helium-snapshot', 'devstack/odl-releases/lithium-snapshot-0.3.1', 'devstack/odl-releases/lithium-snapshot-0.3.0', 'devstack/plugin.sh', 'devstack/settings'], 'message': "Add Beryllium and Lithium Stable support

This patch does the following:

a) adds release support for ODL Be and Li/stable
b) Now that Li/stable is cut, this should be the default release to test against
c) Add a configuration to point the gate to a release of our choice; keep it
   different from the default one, to avoid messing around with local dev's envs
d) Reorganize the tree a bit to deal with the increasing number of releases we
   may want to test/support going forward.

Change-Id: I85867ad84c780167edf0ffcb938ae20988cfb044
"}]
commit_message:
Add Beryllium and Lithium Stable support

This patch does the following:

a) adds release support for ODL Be and Li/stable
b) Now that Li/stable is cut, this should be the default release to test against
c) Add a configuration to point the gate to a release of our choice; keep it
   different from the default one, to avoid messing around with local dev's envs
d) Reorganize the tree a bit to deal with the increasing number of releases we
   may want to test/support going forward.

Change-Id: I85867ad84c780167edf0ffcb938ae20988cfb044

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-06-30 16:39:46.000000000', 'files': ['os_brick/tests/initiator/test_connector.py', 'os_brick/initiator/connector.py'], 'message': "FC Eliminate the need to return devices list

This patch removes the need to build the list of devices found
when multipath was not being used.   At disconnect_volume time
for FC, we now use the device path to discover the actual device
information to remove the SCSI device from the system instead of
relying on the devices list, which isn't used by multipath anymore.

Change-Id: I5357c8cdf0976eee80120636f0a53f711db23016
Related-Bug: 1406161
"}]
commit_message:
FC Eliminate the need to return devices list

This patch removes the need to build the list of devices found
when multipath was not being used.   At disconnect_volume time
for FC, we now use the device path to discover the actual device
information to remove the SCSI device from the system instead of
relying on the devices list, which isn't used by multipath anymore.

Change-Id: I5357c8cdf0976eee80120636f0a53f711db23016
Related-Bug: 1406161

subject: Decrease link delay for non-boot interfaces
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-09 09:44:57.000000000', 'files': ['bootstrap/sync/etc/init.d/setup-bootdev'], 'message': 'Decrease link delay for non-boot interfaces

In system tests we attach 5+ network interfaces
to slaves VMs, so node bootstrapping takes few
minutes, because network scripts are waiting
30 seconds while trying to get IP over DHCP on
each interface not connected to admin network.
This patch decreases link delay time to 10 sec
for all interfcases except the interface which
slave was booted from.

Change-Id: I9300a55cff0b27b5efbbcf7d076805710d5752f1
Related-bug: #1417009
'}]
commit_message:
Decrease link delay for non-boot interfaces

In system tests we attach 5+ network interfaces
to slaves VMs, so node bootstrapping takes few
minutes, because network scripts are waiting
30 seconds while trying to get IP over DHCP on
each interface not connected to admin network.
This patch decreases link delay time to 10 sec
for all interfcases except the interface which
slave was booted from.

Change-Id: I9300a55cff0b27b5efbbcf7d076805710d5752f1
Related-bug: #1417009

commit_message:
Add possibility to deploy swift proxy

 - Added ability to deploy swift-proxy/swift-storage role
 - Removed hardcode keystone settings for user/tenant/host
 - Added flag for keystone endpoint/user/service creation
 - Renamed $swift_proxies settings because of conflict with haproxy
 - Renamed $controller_node_address for keystone auth

Partial blueprint: detach-components-from-controllers
Co-Authored-By: Nikita Koshikov <nkoshikov@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I7d8890bd60ff39684839a721e8169f3608a68f5d

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2015-06-17 09:10:44.000000000', 'files': ['specs/ansible-multi.rst'], 'message': 'Ansible multi-node specification

This specification outlines some of the design goals and practices to
be used to implement an Ansible multi-node deployment tool.  The goals
of this work are simplicity, optimizing deployment time, and Operator
flexibility.

The long term objective is for Kolla to become the de-facto solution
for deploying OpenStack in containers.

Partially Implements: blueprint ansible-multi
Co-Authored-By: Sam Yaple <sam@yaple.net>

Change-Id: I8c5d8b7e69c4ed54624061428e2fbde6af6a1815
'}]
commit_message:
Ansible multi-node specification

This specification outlines some of the design goals and practices to
be used to implement an Ansible multi-node deployment tool.  The goals
of this work are simplicity, optimizing deployment time, and Operator
flexibility.

The long term objective is for Kolla to become the de-facto solution
for deploying OpenStack in containers.

Partially Implements: blueprint ansible-multi
Co-Authored-By: Sam Yaple <sam@yaple.net>

Change-Id: I8c5d8b7e69c4ed54624061428e2fbde6af6a1815

commit_message:
Move fileutils functions to oslo.policy

read_cached_file and delete_cached_file are only used in
oslo.policy. isolate the functions there so we can depreate
fileutils.

Change-Id: Ibbcda87eba6e21ace8904e1fb4c700e0790fb477

commit_message:
Move to oslo_service

The Neutron core removed the loopingcall it was maintaining internally
and switched to the oslo_service.  This change set mirrors the changes
done in Neutron core within the decomposed ML2 PowerVM Agent.

This change set also updated the requirements.txt to match the version
levels with the current Neutron.

Change-Id: Ia688777880f1d3cdbd82823c4c3a031ef5634bbe

commit_message:
Remove managed stable/icehouse branch testing

Remove jobs which test stable/icehouse branches of repos tagged
release:managed as the branch has reached end-of-life and is being
removed from those repos.

Change-Id: I88a44cfa84597012af7da0bd22de02dc2349b1fa

commit_message:
Fix LDAP group filter

Role assignment to group (in LDAP) fails: Bad search filter

An invalid LDAP group filter was constructed, because None was coerced
to the string "None" and inserted into the middle of the query.

Change-Id: Ifd5fd7166bf3f36f639abffc44d3e9d7342863e3
Closes-Bug: 1470570
Signed-off-by: Hans Feldt <hans.feldt@ericsson.com>

commit_message:
Fix l3 agent to not create already deleted router

In case router is deleted during l3 agent resync,
the "deleted" event is processed with higher priority, then
resync event for the router may be processed which will recreate
already deleted router.
This happens due to timestamp not being properly updated for deleted
router in router processor.
The fix adds timestamp update for deleted router.

Functional test will be updated in a follow-up patch

Logging was improved to make debugging a bit easier.

Closes-Bug: #1455439
Change-Id: I2d060064acccc10591a3d90be9011f116548cfce
(cherry picked from commit 74b0c53da5d7e4305606c100becf34966d8af350)
